original: sku'i dkyil 'khor bzhin du spro ba'i dkyil 'khor dgod pa bstan to //🔽sems kyis gzhan ni mi bsam par //
analyzed: sku'i dkyil 'khor bzhin du spro ba'i dkyil 'khor dgod pa bstan to // sems kyis gzhan ni mi bsam par //
translated: By this, the arrangement of the emanation mandala is taught, like the body mandala.

original: zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Not thinking of anything else with the mind,

original: rdo rje'i phreng ba las gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' tshad mar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje'i phreng ba las gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' tshad mar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Up to it is taught in the Vajra Garland.

original: rigs pa 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug bsdus pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug bsdus pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: By this reasoning, and so on shows the summary.

original: gleng gzhi'i dbang du mdzad nas kyang //
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i dbang du mdzad nas kyang //
translated: And also, taking the nidana as the authority,

original: don gang yin pa bstan pa yin //
analyzed: don gang yin pa bstan pa yin //
translated: The meaning that is taught,

original: rgyud kyi don ni lhag ma rnams //🔽zhar la yang dag bshad pa yin ;
analyzed: rgyud kyi don ni lhag ma rnams // zhar la yang dag bshad pa yin ;
translated: The remaining meanings of the tantra,🔽Are also explained incidentally.

original: / zhes bya ba ni 'grel ba byed pa rang gi tshigs bcad yin no //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni 'grel ba byed pa rang gi tshigs bcad yin no //
translated: This is a verse of the commentator himself.

original: 'dir don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the meaning:

original: gleng gzhi ni dang po'i ngag yin no //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni dang po'i ngag yin no //
translated: The nidana is the first statement.

original: yang na bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' yin no //
analyzed: yang na bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' yin no //
translated: Or it is the word of the Blessed One.

original: dbang du mdzad pa ni brten nas so //
analyzed: dbang du mdzad pa ni brten nas so //
translated: The “empowerment” is the basis.

original: don gang yin pa bstan pa ni yang dag par bstan pa yin te de nyid du rgyud kyi don mtha' dag bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don gang yin pa bstan pa ni yang dag par bstan pa yin te de nyid du rgyud kyi don mtha' dag bstan pa yin no //
translated: The “teaching” is the indication of the meaning, and it is the teaching of the entire meaning of the tantra.

original: de'i 'og tu khyad par dang tha dad par bshad pa de ni lhag ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu khyad par dang tha dad par bshad pa de ni lhag ma yin te /
translated: After that, the “remainder” is the special and different explanation.

original: zhar la bshad pa dang spros pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhar la bshad pa dang spros pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the digression and the elaboration, is the meaning.

original: ji ltar 'grel pa byed pas de ltar bzhugs pa'i tshig nyid kyis rgyud ma lus pa'i dgos pa bstan nas zhes pa lta bu'o//
analyzed: ji ltar 'grel pa byed pas de ltar bzhugs pa'i tshig nyid kyis rgyud ma lus pa'i dgos pa bstan nas zhes pa lta bu'o//
translated: Just as the commentator says, “Having thus taught the purpose of the entire tantra with the words of the introduction,”

original: de len cing 'dzin par byed pas na zhes bya ba'i sgra dgod pa'i rgyu mtshan tsam mo //
analyzed: de len cing 'dzin par byed pas na zhes bya ba'i sgra dgod pa'i rgyu mtshan tsam mo //
translated: the word “thus” is merely the reason for the composition.

original: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gzhal bya mthar thug pa'i sa yin no //
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gzhal bya mthar thug pa'i sa yin no //
translated: The reason for the use of the word is the ultimate stage of the object of knowledge.

original: gzhan du na le'ur bcad pa la sogs pa'i don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na le'ur bcad pa la sogs pa'i don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no meaning of the chapters, etc.

original: de'i phyir gzhung dang don rdzogs pa las le'u la sogs par nges par brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhung dang don rdzogs pa las le'u la sogs par nges par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the chapters, etc., are definitely expressed from the complete text and meaning.

original: sgron ma gsal ba zhes bya ba'i sa bcad pa las /
analyzed: sgron ma gsal ba zhes bya ba'i sa bcad pa las /
translated: The first chapter of the treatise called “The Clear Lamp”

original: le'u dang po'o /
analyzed: le'u dang po'o /
translated: is finished.

original: // / de ltar le'u dang por thams cad bskyed nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar le'u dang por thams cad bskyed nas /
translated: Having generated everything in the first chapter,

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsol ba btab pa dang lan rtsom pa'o //🔽khyed kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas ;
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsol ba btab pa dang lan rtsom pa'o // khyed kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas ;
translated: up to “just as it is spoken” is the request of all the Tathāgatas and the response.

original: nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gsung thugs dbyer med par bstan to //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gsung thugs dbyer med par bstan to //
translated: “You” and so on up to “definitive meaning” teaches the indivisibility of the Bhagavat’s body, speech, and mind.

original: de la man ngag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la man ngag ni 'di yin te /
translated: The instruction is this:

original: re zhig sems ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: re zhig sems ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin te /
translated: First, the mind is naturally luminous.🔽In the center of the dharma-dhātu cakra with eight spokes,

original: rtsibs brgyad kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo'i snying por de rjes su myong bas /
analyzed: rtsibs brgyad kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo'i snying por de rjes su myong bas /
translated: by experiencing that,

original: @182a * // des na de las de'i mod la dbang po'i gzhu bzhin du rnam par spro ba ni sems lus lta bur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: @182a * // des na de las de'i mod la dbang po'i gzhu bzhin du rnam par spro ba ni sems lus lta bur gyur pa yin no //
translated: immediately from that, like the bow of the sense organ, the mind is expanded, and the body becomes like the mind.

original: sems tshig tu brjod la lta bu zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas nam mkha' las a'a li k'a li 'byung ba ni sems tshig tu brjod pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: sems tshig tu brjod la lta bu zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas nam mkha' las a'a li k'a li 'byung ba ni sems tshig tu brjod pa lta bu yin no //
translated: The mind-like speech is the arising of the vowels and consonants from the realm of the realm of phenomena, space, which is like the mind's speech.

original: lus sems lta bu dang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba der lus thim par gyur pa ni lus sems lta bu yin no //🔽ae ma ho zhes bya ba la sogs pa la zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: lus sems lta bu dang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba der lus thim par gyur pa ni lus sems lta bu yin no // ae ma ho zhes bya ba la sogs pa la zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The body-like mind is the dissolution of the body into that natural luminosity, which is like the body's mind.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos bstan pa la dad pa g-yo ste /
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos bstan pa la dad pa g-yo ste /
translated: The like this and so on up to not the intended meaning shows that the Tathagatas are wavering in their faith in teaching the Dharma.

original: tshig tu rdo rje 'chang chen po las rjes su yi rang bar bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig tu rdo rje 'chang chen po las rjes su yi rang bar bstod pa yin no //
translated: In words, it is a praise of rejoicing from Great Vajradhara.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa drug po rnams kyis zhes bya ba nas mthar thug pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bka' yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa drug po rnams kyis zhes bya ba nas mthar thug pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bka' yin no //
translated: The six Tathagatas and so on up to ultimate shows that it is the word of Great Vajradhara.

original: yi ge'i don gyis phyogs la ni bsgom par bya ba la med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad kyis ni stong pa nyid tsam du ston pa yin no //
analyzed: yi ge'i don gyis phyogs la ni bsgom par bya ba la med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad kyis ni stong pa nyid tsam du ston pa yin no //
translated: In the sense of the syllables, in the sense of the side, it is said, “because it does not exist in the object of meditation.”

original: spyi'i don gyi phyogs la ni rnam par thar pa sgo gsum gyi sgo nas mdo sde ba'i 'gyod pa bsal bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i don gyi phyogs la ni rnam par thar pa sgo gsum gyi sgo nas mdo sde ba'i 'gyod pa bsal bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: In the sense of the general meaning, in the sense of the side, it is said, “the Sautrāntika regret is taught by way of the three doors of liberation.”

original: sbas pa'i phyogs la ni rang byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: sbas pa'i phyogs la ni rang byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: In the sense of the hidden, in the sense of the side, it is said, “the stage of self-consecration is taught.”

original: mthar thug pa'i phyogs la ni mngon par byang chub pa'i sems dang / zur du 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i phyogs la ni mngon par byang chub pa'i sems dang / zur du 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: In the sense of the ultimate, in the sense of the side, it is said, “the stage of manifest enlightenment and the stage of entry into the corner is taught.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the Bhagavān Vairocana, etc.

original: dgongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rnam par snang mdzad kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rnam par snang mdzad kyis gsungs so //
translated: up to “it is not the intended meaning” is the statement of Vairocana.

original: dngos po thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems kyi tshigs su bcad pa slob dpon klu sgrub kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa rim par bshad pa de la rgya cher blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems kyi tshigs su bcad pa slob dpon klu sgrub kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa rim par bshad pa de la rgya cher blta bar bya'o //
translated: The statement free from all things is a verse on the thought of awakening, and its commentary, the Explanation of the Stages, should be studied in detail.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mi zad pa'i yang dag pa'i mtha'o zhes bya ba nas /🔽dgongs pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa dang po mi smos pa ci zhe na /🔽lus la gnas sel dgos so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mi zad pa'i yang dag pa'i mtha'o zhes bya ba nas / dgongs pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa dang po mi smos pa ci zhe na / lus la gnas sel dgos so //
translated: The statement the inexhaustible limit of reality of all tathāgatas is a verse spoken by Amitābha.

original: mi bskyod pas gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
analyzed: mi bskyod pas gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
translated: The statement non-intentional is a verse spoken by Akṣobhya.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i don bstan to //🔽de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i don bstan to // de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The statement the nature of the mind is clear light is a verse spoken by Ratnasambhava.

original: yang dgongs pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyis gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dgongs pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyis gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
translated: The statement the nature of the mind is clear light is a verse spoken by Amoghasiddhi.🔽The statement the nature of the mind is clear light is a verse spoken by Vairocana.🔽The statement the nature of the mind is clear light is a verse spoken by Vajrasattva.🔽The statement the nature of the mind is clear light is a verse spoken by Vajradhara.

original: mngon par byang chub pa dang @182b rang byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa dang @182b rang byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: The stage of manifest enlightenment and self-consecration are taught.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Then,

original: yang dgongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'od dpag med kyis gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dgongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'od dpag med kyis gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
translated: up to “not the intended meaning” is the verse spoken by Amitābha.

original: zung du 'jug pa'i don dam pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i don dam pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: It teaches the ultimate reality of union.

original: yang de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: yang de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: Then again,

original: yang dgongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni don yod grub pas gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dgongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni don yod grub pas gsungs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
translated: up to “not the intended meaning” is the verse spoken by Amoghasiddhi.

original: de yang zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: de yang zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: It also teaches the stage of union.

original: 'o na dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo rdo rje 'chang chen po yin pas des gsungs par rigs na /
analyzed: 'o na dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo rdo rje 'chang chen po yin pas des gsungs par rigs na /
translated: Well, since the principal one of the maṇḍala is Great Vajradhara, it is appropriate that he speaks.

original: ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan rnams kyis gsungs she na de la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan rnams kyis gsungs she na de la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: Why do the other tathāgatas speak? There is no fault.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin la /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin la /
translated: Great Vajradhara is the saṃbhogakāya.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni sprul pa'i sku yin pas rgyu dang 'bras bu tha mi dad pa'i phyir de ltar gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni sprul pa'i sku yin pas rgyu dang 'bras bu tha mi dad pa'i phyir de ltar gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Tathāgatas are the emanation body, and it is said that the cause and effect are not different.

original: de yang mdzad pa gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang mdzad pa gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is because they have the same activity.🔽Then, after that, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Up to:

original: chos ston par mdzad pa'i rnam par bstod pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: chos ston par mdzad pa'i rnam par bstod pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: The praise of the one who teaches the Dharma.

original: bstod pa'i gleng bslang ba bstan to //
analyzed: bstod pa'i gleng bslang ba bstan to //
translated: This shows the introduction to the praise.

original: yang dag pa'i de kho na'i don ni 'od gsal ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i de kho na'i don ni 'od gsal ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The meaning of thatness is clear light, etc.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu tha mi dad pa'i phyir de ltar gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu tha mi dad pa'i phyir de ltar gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that the cause and effect are not different.

original: de yang mdzad pa gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang mdzad pa gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is because they have the same activity.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then, after that, etc.

original: chos ston par mdzad pa'i rnam par bstod pa'o //
analyzed: chos ston par mdzad pa'i rnam par bstod pa'o //
translated: The praise of the one who teaches the Dharma.

original: sgra ji bzhin par bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub kyi sems kyi tshigs bcad gsungs pa gang yin pa de nyid bstod pa'i sgo nas mjug sdud par bstan pa yin no ;🔽/ de bas na bstod pa dang / mjug sdud par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin par bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub kyi sems kyi tshigs bcad gsungs pa gang yin pa de nyid bstod pa'i sgo nas mjug sdud par bstan pa yin no ; / de bas na bstod pa dang / mjug sdud par bstan pa ni /
translated: The passage up to “explained literally” teaches the conclusion by way of praise of just that verse that was spoken on the thought of awakening.

original: tshigs bcad bzhis bstan par shes par bya'o //🔽sgron ma gsal ba zhes bya ba'i sa bcad pa las /
analyzed: tshigs bcad bzhis bstan par shes par bya'o // sgron ma gsal ba zhes bya ba'i sa bcad pa las /
translated: Therefore, the teaching of praise and conclusion should be understood as taught by four verses.

original: le'u gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: le'u gnyis pa'o /
translated: This concludes the second chapter in the treatise called Illuminating Lamp.

original: // / rnal 'byor pa rnam pa gnyis kyi phra mo bsgom pa rnam pa gnyis bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / rnal 'byor pa rnam pa gnyis kyi phra mo bsgom pa rnam pa gnyis bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The two types of yogis should cultivate the two types of subtle meditation.

original: rnal 'byor rnam pa gnyis ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rnam pa gnyis ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The two types of yoga are the two types of creation and completion.

original: dang po stong pa nyid kyi byang chub rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: dang po stong pa nyid kyi byang chub rnam pa gcig go //
translated: The first is the one type of emptiness awakening.

original: sku'i rnam pa rdzogs pa dang / sna'i rtse mo la sogs pa'i gnas su sgom pa'i phra mo'i sgom pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sku'i rnam pa rdzogs pa dang / sna'i rtse mo la sogs pa'i gnas su sgom pa'i phra mo'i sgom pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the meditation on the subtle at the tip of the nose and so forth, which is the complete form of the body.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o zhes bya ba nas /🔽bskyed @183a * //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o zhes bya ba nas / bskyed @183a * //
translated: Then the Lord spoke.🔽This is the samadhi of the creation stage.

original: ba'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bskyed pa'i rim pa 'ba' zhig bstan to //
analyzed: ba'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bskyed pa'i rim pa 'ba' zhig bstan to //
translated: This passage teaches only the creation stage.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dkyil 'khor gtsor byas nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dkyil 'khor gtsor byas nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it teaches that stage with the mandala of the five Tathagatas as the principal deity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Tathagata, etc.

original: nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'od gsal ba la zhugs pa'i 'og tu rang byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'od gsal ba la zhugs pa'i 'og tu rang byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: This passage teaches the stage of self-consecration after entering into clearlight.

original: rigs lnga'i bye brag la brten nas de ma thag rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba las langs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs lnga'i bye brag la brten nas de ma thag rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba las langs pa'o //
translated: It is the arising from the natural clearlight in dependence upon the distinctions of the five clans.

original: da ni rang gi sems bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: da ni rang gi sems bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Now, in order to teach one's own mind, etc.

original: mthar thug pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phra mor sbyor ba rnam pa gsum bstan to //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phra mor sbyor ba rnam pa gsum bstan to //
translated: This passage teaches the three types of subtle yoga.

original: spyi'i don gyi phyogs la ni sna'i rtse mor thig le bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i don gyi phyogs la ni sna'i rtse mor thig le bsgom pa'o //
translated: In the general sense, one should meditate on the drop at the tip of the nose.

original: sbas pa'i phyogs la ni rdo rje dang padma'i snying po la thig le bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sbas pa'i phyogs la ni rdo rje dang padma'i snying po la thig le bsgom pa'o //
translated: In the hidden sense, one should meditate on the drop at the heart of the vajra and lotus.

original: mthar thug pa'i phyogs la ni snying gi padma'i snying po la thig le bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i phyogs la ni snying gi padma'i snying po la thig le bsgom pa'o //
translated: In the ultimate sense, one should meditate on the drop at the heart of the heart lotus.

original: de ltar 'di dag dbye ba'i rnam pa ni gti mug dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang can gyi sems kyi dbye bas bstan pa yin no //🔽rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'di dag dbye ba'i rnam pa ni gti mug dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang can gyi sems kyi dbye bas bstan pa yin no // rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: Thus, these divisions are taught by the divisions of the minds of those who are deluded, passionate, and hateful.

original: drang ba'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phra mo'i sbyor ba bstan par gyur nas /
analyzed: drang ba'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phra mo'i sbyor ba bstan par gyur nas /
translated: The phrase Vairochana and so forth up to the provisional meaning teaches the subtle yoga.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dkyil 'khor spro bar bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dkyil 'khor spro bar bstan to //
translated: Having taught that, it teaches the emanation of the maṇḍala of the five tathāgatas.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings ni zhes bya ba nas nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dkyil 'khor bzhi pa'i rim pas dkar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer spro ba'i sngon du 'gro bas //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings ni zhes bya ba nas nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dkyil 'khor bzhi pa'i rim pas dkar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer spro ba'i sngon du 'gro bas //
translated: The passage from in the realm of space up to definitive meaning shows the accomplishment of pacification, etc. by the process of the fourth maṇḍala, preceded by the emission of white, etc. light rays,

original: zhi ba la sogs pa bsgrub cing sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad spros shing bsdus nas /🔽rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba rtogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa bsgrub cing sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad spros shing bsdus nas / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba rtogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: and the realization of the natural luminosity of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, having emanated and gathered them.

original: mtha' drug gis bshad pa'i le'u gsum pa'o /
analyzed: mtha' drug gis bshad pa'i le'u gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the third chapter explaining the six parameters.

original: // / lha la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni le'u'i skabs ston pa yin no //
analyzed: // / lha la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni le'u'i skabs ston pa yin no //
translated: The phrase preceded by the observation of the deity indicates the topic of the chapter.

original: de nyid nas dgongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa lngas rigs lnga dang rigs gsum gyi rim pas rdo rje 'chang chen po la bstod pa bstan to //🔽de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nyid nas dgongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa lngas rigs lnga dang rigs gsum gyi rim pas rdo rje 'chang chen po la bstod pa bstan to //🔽de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The passage from not the intended meaning up to the five tathāgatas shows the praise of Mahāvajradhara by the five tathāgatas in the sequence of the five families and the three families.🔽The passage from then up to the five tathāgatas shows the praise of Mahāvajradhara by the five tathāgatas in the sequence of the five families and the three families.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'i bar gyis ni sdud pa pos rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bka' rjes su brjod pa bstan to //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'i bar gyis ni sdud pa pos rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bka' rjes su brjod pa bstan to //
translated: The passage up to “just as it is” shows the compiler’s repetition of the words of Mahāvajradhara.🔽The passage from “by the speech of Mahāvajradhara” up to “the meaning of the tantra” shows the compiler’s repetition of the words of Vajrapāṇi.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gsung gis zhes bya ba nas /🔽'dir @183b yang rgya cher ni dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga las blta bar bya'o zhes pa'i bar gyis ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor phyag mtshan dang / sku mdog dang phyag rgya dang / tshad dang ldan pa ji lta ba bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gsung gis zhes bya ba nas / 'dir @183b yang rgya cher ni dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga las blta bar bya'o zhes pa'i bar gyis ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor phyag mtshan dang / sku mdog dang phyag rgya dang / tshad dang ldan pa ji lta ba bzhin du bstan to //
translated: The passage from “the meaning of the tantra” up to “the meaning of the tantra” shows the compiler’s repetition of the words of Vajrasattva.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga ni rang nyid kyis byas pa'o //🔽gang gi phyir sangs rgyas ye shes kyi zhal snga nas kyis ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha bcu dgur bzhed pa yin la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga ni rang nyid kyis byas pa'o // gang gi phyir sangs rgyas ye shes kyi zhal snga nas kyis ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha bcu dgur bzhed pa yin la /
translated: The passage from “the meaning of the tantra” up to “the meaning of the tantra” shows the compiler’s repetition of the words of Vajraratna.🔽The passage from “the meaning of the tantra” up to “the meaning of the tantra” shows the compiler’s repetition of the words of Vajraviṣkambhin.

original: zla grags kyi zhal snga nas kyis ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha sum cu rtsa gnyis su bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: zla grags kyi zhal snga nas kyis ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha sum cu rtsa gnyis su bzhed pa yin no //
translated: The passage from “the meaning of the tantra” up to “the meaning of the tantra” shows the compiler’s repetition of the words of Vajrarāja.🔽The passage from “the meaning of the tantra” up to “the meaning of the tantra” shows the compiler’s repetition of the words of Vajrarāga.🔽The passage from “the meaning of the tantra” up to “the meaning of the tantra” shows the compiler’s repetition of the words of Vajrasādhu.🔽The passage from “the meaning of the tantra” up to “the meaning of the tantra” shows the compiler’s repetition of the words of Vajrakarma.🔽The passage from “the meaning of the tantra” up to “the meaning of the tantra” shows the compiler’s repetition of the words of Vajrahetu.🔽The passage from “the meaning of the tantra” up to “the meaning of the tantra” shows the compiler’s repetition of the words of Vajraviśva.🔽The passage from “the meaning of the tantra” up to “the meaning of the tantra” shows the compiler’s repetition of the words of Vajranṛtyā.🔽The passage from “the meaning of the tantra” up to “the meaning of the tantra” shows the compiler’s repetition of the words of Vajratejas.🔽The passage from “the meaning of the tantra” up to “the meaning of the tantra” shows the compiler’s repetition of the words of Vajrapuṣp

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud nas ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha bcu gsum la bdag nyid du gsungs te de'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga las blta bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud nas ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha bcu gsum la bdag nyid du gsungs te de'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga las blta bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The Root Tantra teaches that the thirteen mandala deities are the self, and therefore it is said that one should look at the mandala ritual.

original: 'dir yang dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga gleng gzhi'i dbang du byas nas kyang don 'grel pa mkhan gyis mdzad pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga gleng gzhi'i dbang du byas nas kyang don 'grel pa mkhan gyis mdzad pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the meaning commentary is to be seen as being done in terms of the mandala ritual nidana.

original: lus dang zhes bya ba nas drang ba'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa dang / bdud rtsi lnga la spyod par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: lus dang zhes bya ba nas drang ba'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa dang / bdud rtsi lnga la spyod par bstan pa yin te /
translated: From body up to interpretable meaning teaches the pledge seal union and the practice of the five nectars,

original: 'di nyid ni mchod pa rab mchog yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni mchod pa rab mchog yin te /
translated: and this is the best worship.

original: 'di lta ste gsang ba'i mchod pa yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste gsang ba'i mchod pa yin pas so //
translated: This is because it is the secret worship.

original: me tog dang spos la sogs pa ni bcos ma'i mchod pa dang / de'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir gtso bo ma yin no zhes bsams so //
analyzed: me tog dang spos la sogs pa ni bcos ma'i mchod pa dang / de'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir gtso bo ma yin no zhes bsams so //
translated: Flowers, incense, and so on are artificial worship, and because they are its branches, they are not the main thing, he thinks.

original: lung gi bshad pa brjod par bya ste zhes bya pa nas des pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni nang gi dkyil 'khor dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'i mchod pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lung gi bshad pa brjod par bya ste zhes bya pa nas des pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni nang gi dkyil 'khor dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'i mchod pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of the scripture should be stated, up to the meaning of the well-spoken. This teaches the inner maṇḍala and the worship of entering into natural luminosity.

original: de la dgu pa'i bdag nyid ni chags pa dang / chags pa dang bral ba dang / chags pa 'bring dang / stong pa dang / shin tu stong pa dang / stong pa chen po dang / snang ba dang / snang ba mched pa dang /
analyzed: de la dgu pa'i bdag nyid ni chags pa dang / chags pa dang bral ba dang / chags pa 'bring dang / stong pa dang / shin tu stong pa dang / stong pa chen po dang / snang ba dang / snang ba mched pa dang /
translated: There, the nature of the nine is attachment, detachment, middling attachment, emptiness, great emptiness, great emptiness, appearance, increase of appearance,

original: snang ba thob pa de'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: snang ba thob pa de'i bdag nyid do //
translated: and attainment of appearance. That is its nature.

original: kha cig ni dam pa'i chos gsungs rab yan lag dgu yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: kha cig ni dam pa'i chos gsungs rab yan lag dgu yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: Some explain that it is the nine branches of the excellent Dharma.

original: skad cig sogs kyi dus dbye bas //
analyzed: skad cig sogs kyi dus dbye bas //
translated: The divisions of time such as moments,

original: bcu drug lo ni ming du gyur //
analyzed: bcu drug lo ni ming du gyur //
translated: the sixteen years, and so on, are named.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par nyid pa dang / dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / dga' bral dang / bsnyen pa dang / nye ba'i bsnyen pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par nyid pa dang / dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / dga' bral dang / bsnyen pa dang / nye ba'i bsnyen pa dang /
translated: supreme joy,🔽innate joy,🔽the absence of joy,🔽approach,🔽near-approach,🔽accomplishment,🔽great accomplishment,🔽emptiness,🔽great emptiness,

original: sgrub pa dang / sgrub pa chen po dang / stong ba dang / shin tu stong pa dang / stong pa chen po dang / thams cad stong pa po ni /🔽skad cig ma bcu drug ces @184a * //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang / sgrub pa chen po dang / stong ba dang / shin tu stong pa dang / stong pa chen po dang / thams cad stong pa po ni / skad cig ma bcu drug ces @184a * //
translated: and all emptiness.

original: bya'o ; / kha cig stong pa bcu drug nyid yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: bya'o ; / kha cig stong pa bcu drug nyid yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: Some explain that there are sixteen emptinesses.

original: gang yang 'jig rten pas brtags pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni don dam pa'i phyogs bstan pa yin no //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang yang 'jig rten pas brtags pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni don dam pa'i phyogs bstan pa yin no // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba nas /
translated: The phrase what is imagined by the world indicates the ultimate.

original: yang nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni kun rdzob pa dang don dam pa'i sgo nas dkyil 'khor gyi mjug bsdu pa bstan to //
analyzed: yang nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni kun rdzob pa dang don dam pa'i sgo nas dkyil 'khor gyi mjug bsdu pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase all tathāgatas up to definitive meaning indicates the conclusion of the maṇḍala from the perspective of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: mtha' drug gis bshad pa'i le'u bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: mtha' drug gis bshad pa'i le'u bzhi pa'o /
translated: Chapter four has been explained by the six parameters.

original: // / rim pa gnyis pa rtogs pa ni le'u lnga pa'i skabs ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: // / rim pa gnyis pa rtogs pa ni le'u lnga pa'i skabs ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: The second stage is realized in the section of chapter five.

original: dbang bskur ba thob pas kyang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba thob pas kyang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Having obtained initiation, etc.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos ston pa'i skabs bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos ston pa'i skabs bstan pa yin no //
translated: up to just as the words are, shows the section of the teaching of the Bhagavat.

original: rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba nas /
translated: Non-conceptual, etc.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'od gsal ba rtogs pas byang chub yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'od gsal ba rtogs pas byang chub yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: up to non-intentional shows that enlightenment is the realization of clear light.🔽The thorough knowledge of the nature, etc.

original: rang bzhin yongs su shes pa nyid ces bya ba nas sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni spro ba'i spyod pa bstan to //
analyzed: rang bzhin yongs su shes pa nyid ces bya ba nas sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni spro ba'i spyod pa bstan to //
translated: up to just as the words are shows the conduct of emanation.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po khyad par du zhes pa nas //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po khyad par du zhes pa nas //
translated: The king of tantras, etc.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bstan to //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bstan to //
translated: up to intentional explanation shows the conduct of non-emanation.

original: ma dang sring mo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ma dang sring mo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Mother and sister, etc.

original: nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bstan to //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bstan to //
translated: By definitive meaning he taught the extremely unelaborate conduct.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la zhes bya ba nas //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la zhes bya ba nas //
translated: Then, and so on, up to what is the reason for that?

original: ci'i phyir mdzad ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni sgra ji bzhin pa'i don 'dzin pa tsam gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams skyo bar gyur pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir mdzad ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni sgra ji bzhin pa'i don 'dzin pa tsam gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams skyo bar gyur pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: He taught that the bodhisattvas become discouraged by merely holding the literal meaning.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rgyan khyad par can bstan pas /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rgyan khyad par can bstan pas /
translated: Then, and so on, up to the literal meaning, he taught the special ornament,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi the tshom sel ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi the tshom sel ba yin no //
translated: and thereby removed the bodhisattvas' doubts.

original: de nas yang brjod kyis mi lang pa zhes bya ba nas /🔽drang ba'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de kho na nyid kyi bdud rtsi myangs pas /
analyzed: de nas yang brjod kyis mi lang pa zhes bya ba nas / drang ba'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de kho na nyid kyi bdud rtsi myangs pas /
translated: Then, and so on, up to inexpressible,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams g-yo ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob par bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams g-yo ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob par bstan to //
translated: he taught that the bodhisattvas attain the unshakable meditative concentration by tasting the nectar of reality.

original: yang lung gis bshad pa zhes bya ba nas /🔽nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba rtogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yang lung gis bshad pa zhes bya ba nas / nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba rtogs pa'i phyir //
translated: Again, explained by scripture up to is of definitive meaning explains that the bliss of the first stage is the bliss of the first stage, and the bliss of the second stage is the bliss of the second stage, and so on.🔽🔽

original: rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma thams cad zad par bstan pa yin no //🔽mkha' dang mnyam zhing zhes bya ba nas /🔽nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma thams cad zad par bstan pa yin no // mkha' dang mnyam zhing zhes bya ba nas / nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Again, explained by the scriptures up to definitive meaning teaches the exhaustion of all the stains of conceptual thought in order to realize the co-emergent joy.

original: byang chub sems @184b dpa' rnams dbugs phyung ba dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba dang / rang byin gyis brlab pa bstan to //🔽de nas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems @184b dpa' rnams dbugs phyung ba dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba dang / rang byin gyis brlab pa bstan to // de nas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Equal to space up to definitive meaning teaches the consoling of the bodhisattvas, natural luminosity, and self-consecration.

original: le'u rdzogs pa dgongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams ngo mtshar du gyur nas /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa lnga gtsor byas pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: le'u rdzogs pa dgongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams ngo mtshar du gyur nas / de bzhin gshegs pa lnga gtsor byas pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Then, thus have I heard up to the chapter is not definitive teaches the bodhisattvas' amazement.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po la bstod pa byed par stan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po la bstod pa byed par stan to //
translated: Through the five tathāgatas being primary, it teaches the praise of Bhagavān Mahāvajradhara.

original: mtha' drug gis bshad pa'i le'ur lnga pa'o /
analyzed: mtha' drug gis bshad pa'i le'ur lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the fifth chapter with the explanation of the six parameters.

original: // / bdag byin byis brlab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni le'u drug pa'i skabs ston par byed do //
analyzed: // / bdag byin byis brlab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni le'u drug pa'i skabs ston par byed do //
translated: The phrase the so-called self-consecration, etc. indicates the topic of the sixth chapter.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The phrase then, etc. indicates the topic of the seventh chapter.🔽The phrase the three mantras that consecrate body, speech, and mind, etc. indicates the topic of the eighth chapter.🔽The phrase one should consecrate with the three mantras, etc. indicates the topic of the ninth chapter.

original: drang ba'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sku gsung thugs byin gyis rlob par byed pa'i sngags gsum bstan te //🔽de yang mgo la sogs pa'i gnas dag tu lha bkod pa sngon du 'gro bas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: drang ba'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sku gsung thugs byin gyis rlob par byed pa'i sngags gsum bstan te // de yang mgo la sogs pa'i gnas dag tu lha bkod pa sngon du 'gro bas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: The phrase the yoga of the perfection stage, etc. indicates the topic of the tenth chapter.🔽The phrase the yoga of the perfection stage, etc. indicates the topic of the tenth chapter.🔽The phrase the yoga of the perfection stage, etc. indicates the topic of the tenth chapter.🔽The phrase the yoga of the perfection stage, etc. indicates the topic of the tenth chapter.🔽The phrase the yoga of the perfection stage, etc. indicates the topic of the tenth chapter.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis sku dang gsung dang thugs kyis byin gyis brlab pa bshad pa'i rgyud las bstan pa la 'jug par bya ste zhes bya ba 'dis ni lung gi bshad pa bstan to //🔽de nas dpal chen mi bskyod pa dang / zhes bya la sogs pa'i tshig rkang drug ni mi bskyod pas thugs byin gyis brlab pa gsungs pa yin te /
