translated: The phrase the yoga of the perfection stage, etc. indicates the topic of the tenth chapter.🔽The phrase the yoga of the perfection stage, etc. indicates the topic of the tenth chapter.🔽The phrase the yoga of the perfection stage, etc. indicates the topic of the tenth chapter.🔽The phrase the yoga of the perfection stage, etc. indicates the topic of the tenth chapter.🔽The phrase the yoga of the perfection stage, etc. indicates the topic of the tenth chapter.🔽The phrase the yoga of the perfection stage, etc. indicates the topic of the tenth chapter.🔽The phrase the yoga of the perfection stage, etc. indicates the topic of the tenth chapter.🔽The phrase the yoga of the perfection stage, etc. indicates the topic of the tenth chapter.🔽The phrase the yoga of the perfection stage, etc. indicates the topic of the tenth chapter.🔽The phrase the yoga of the perfection stage, etc. indicates the topic of the tenth chapter.🔽The phrase the yoga of the perfection stage, etc. indicates the topic of the tenth chapter.🔽The phrase the yoga of the perfection stage, etc. indicates the topic of the tenth chapter.

original: aom zhes bya ba dang po yin //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba dang po yin //
translated: The syllable om is the first.

original: zhes bya ba dang po'i sgra ni dang po'i sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad la 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang po'i sgra ni dang po'i sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad la 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The word first refers to the first Buddha Vairocana.

original: sarba ta th'a ga ta la thams cad rin chen 'byung ldan te /
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga ta la thams cad rin chen 'byung ldan te /
translated: All Tathagatas refers to Ratnasambhava.

original: nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'od dpag med yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'od dpag med yin te /
translated: Because he is the nature of space.🔽Tathagatas refers to Amitabha.

original: de bzhin ni yang dag pa gsung ba yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin ni yang dag pa gsung ba yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: Tathas means truly; agatas means gone.

original: yon tan ming du zhes bya ba ni sems can dang / rdul dang mun pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan ming du zhes bya ba ni sems can dang / rdul dang mun pa'o //
translated: The name of the qualities refers to sentient beings, dust, and darkness.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i ming ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa gsum gyi don to //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i ming ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa gsum gyi don to //
translated: The name of those is the meaning of the three, Vairocana, and so on.

original: sems kyi rdo rje gnyis ldan zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rdo rje ni tshig gnyis dang ldan pa ste des na mi bskyod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems kyi rdo rje gnyis ldan zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rdo rje ni tshig gnyis dang ldan pa ste des na mi bskyod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mind-vajra endowed with two means the mind-vajra is endowed with two syllables, and by that, it is Akshobhya. This is the meaning.

original: sv'a bh'a wa dang a'atma ko& ham tshig gnyis dang ldan pa ni lnga pa don yod par grub pa yin te /
analyzed: sv'a bh'a wa dang a'atma ko& ham tshig gnyis dang ldan pa ni lnga pa don yod par grub pa yin te /
translated: The fifth is Amoghasiddhi, who has the two words svabhāva and ātmako 'ham.

original: khams gsum gyi rlung gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi rlung gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the nature of the wind of the three realms.

original: gal te yang khams gsum gyi 'gro ba byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo yin yang rlung nyid kyang de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gal te yang khams gsum gyi 'gro ba byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo yin yang rlung nyid kyang de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Even though the beings of the three realms are the essence of bodhicitta, the wind itself is also its essence.

original: rlung ni gzugs su med kyang bde ba chen po'i dbang gis @185a * //🔽gzugs dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: rlung ni gzugs su med kyang bde ba chen po'i dbang gis @185a * // gzugs dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The wind, though formless, has form by the power of great bliss.

original: shin tu drang bar gyur na chu bzhin du sra ba yod pa'i phyir ro //🔽aa ham zhes pa drug pa ste zhes bya ba ni bdag kyang drug pa yin te /
analyzed: shin tu drang bar gyur na chu bzhin du sra ba yod pa'i phyir ro // aa ham zhes pa drug pa ste zhes bya ba ni bdag kyang drug pa yin te /
translated: It is very straight, and because it exists like water, it is hard.🔽The sixth is aham.

original: thams cad kyang de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: I am also the sixth, because everything is of its nature.

original: 'di yan chad ni sems byin gyis brlab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yan chad ni sems byin gyis brlab pa yin no //
translated: Up to this point, it is the consecration of the mind.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad gcig gis ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku byin gyis brlab pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad gcig gis ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku byin gyis brlab pa gsungs so //
translated: One verse beginning with “then” explains the consecration of the body of Vairochana.

original: aom zhes bya ba tshangs par bshad //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba tshangs par bshad //
translated: Om is explained as Brahma.

original: ches bya ba la tshangs pa gnyis su med cing gcig yin no //
analyzed: ches bya ba la tshangs pa gnyis su med cing gcig yin no //
translated: Brahma is non-dual and one.

original: yang na tshangs pa'i don ni dang po'i don te //
analyzed: yang na tshangs pa'i don ni dang po'i don te //
translated: Or, the meaning of Brahma is the meaning of the first,

original: de yang rnam par snang mdzad yin no//
analyzed: de yang rnam par snang mdzad yin no//
translated: and that is Vairochana.

original: sarba ta th'a ga ta zhes bya ba tshig gcig yin te /
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga ta zhes bya ba tshig gcig yin te /
translated: Sarvatathagata is one word.

original: gnyis pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: The second is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: k'a ya zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'od dpag med do //
analyzed: k'a ya zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'od dpag med do //
translated: Kaya is said to be Amitābha.

original: chags gtogs dbang phyug ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: chags gtogs dbang phyug ces bya ba ni /
translated: The one belonging to passion is Maheśvara.

original: de'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ro //
translated: That is his distinction.

original: ke ge sgra'i bkod pas ka ya'i don ni dag gi don to //
analyzed: ke ge sgra'i bkod pas ka ya'i don ni dag gi don to //
translated: By the arrangement of the sound ke, the meaning of kaya is the meaning of ga.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir yang 'od dpag med do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir yang 'od dpag med do //
translated: Because of being the nature of that, it is also Amitābha.

original: rdo rje ni bzhi pa mi bskyod pa yin te bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje ni bzhi pa mi bskyod pa yin te bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Vajra is the fourth, Akṣhobhya, because of being taught.

original: rig byed ni nges brjod kyi rigs byed dang / mchod sbyin gyi rig byed dang / snyan tshig gi rig byed dang / srid srung gi rig byed do //
analyzed: rig byed ni nges brjod kyi rigs byed dang / mchod sbyin gyi rig byed dang / snyan tshig gi rig byed dang / srid srung gi rig byed do //
translated: The Vedas are the Rig Veda, the Yajur Veda, the Sama Veda, and the Atharva Veda.

original: sv'a bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham ni snga ma bzhin du bshad pas don yod par grub pa'o //
analyzed: sv'a bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham ni snga ma bzhin du bshad pas don yod par grub pa'o //
translated: Svabhava atmako ham is explained as before, so it is Amoghasiddhi.

original: 'dod pa'i lha ni lnga ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i lha ni lnga ste /
translated: The five gods of desire are

original: gang gi phyir myos par byed pa dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / rmongs par byed pa dang / gdung bar byed pa dang / skem par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir myos par byed pa dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / rmongs par byed pa dang / gdung bar byed pa dang / skem par byed pa ste /
translated: intoxication, delight, delusion, torment, and emaciation.

original: 'dod pa'i lha'i mda' lnga yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i lha'i mda' lnga yin no //
translated: These are the five arrows of the gods of desire.

original: lnga po de mtshon par byed pas 'dod pa lnga'o //
analyzed: lnga po de mtshon par byed pas 'dod pa lnga'o //
translated: The five are indicated by the five gods of desire.

original: yang na gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang ro dang rig  bya ni 'dod pa'i lha'o //
analyzed: yang na gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang ro dang rig  bya ni 'dod pa'i lha'o //
translated: Alternatively, form, sound, smell, taste, and tactility are the gods of desire.

original: aa ham zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po drug pa'o //
analyzed: aa ham zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po drug pa'o //
translated: Aham means the sixth, Mahāvajradhara.

original: smin drug bu zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu ma gdong drug yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smin drug bu zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu ma gdong drug yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Shasthiputra means the youth with six faces.

original: de nas tshe dpag med ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad gcig gis ni 'od dpag med kyi gsungs byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags gsung ba yin no //
analyzed: de nas tshe dpag med ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad gcig gis ni 'od dpag med kyi gsungs byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags gsung ba yin no //
translated: Then, with one verse beginning “Amitāyus,” he states the mantra of the consecration of the speech of Amitābha.

original: aom ni snga ma bzhin du dang po'i rnam par snang mdzad rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: aom ni snga ma bzhin du dang po'i rnam par snang mdzad rtag pa yin no //
translated: Om is the first, as before, the eternal Vairocana.

original: sarba ta th'a ga ta ni rin chen mgon po gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga ta ni rin chen mgon po gnyis pa yin no //
translated: Sarvatathāgata is the second, Ratnatrayā.

original: w'a ka ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: w'a ka ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Vāk is the nature of that.

original: yon tan gsum ni rdul dang / mun pa dang snying stobs gsum nyid pas gsum po 'od dpag med do//
analyzed: yon tan gsum ni rdul dang / mun pa dang snying stobs gsum nyid pas gsum po 'od dpag med do//
translated: The three qualities are the three, rajas, tamas, and sattva, so the three are Amitābha.

original: @185b rdo rje ni mi bskyod pa bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: @185b rdo rje ni mi bskyod pa bzhi pa ste /
translated: Vajra is the fourth, Akṣobhya.

original: dus ni rdzogs ldan dang / gsum ldan dang / gnyis ldan dang / rtsod pa'i dus so //
analyzed: dus ni rdzogs ldan dang / gsum ldan dang / gnyis ldan dang / rtsod pa'i dus so //
translated: The eons are the four, the perfect, the three, the two, and the strife-filled.

original: sv'a bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham ni lnga pa ste /
analyzed: sv'a bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham ni lnga pa ste /
translated: Svabhāvatako ’ham is the fifth.

original: don yod par grub pa'o //
analyzed: don yod par grub pa'o //
translated: It is Amoghasiddhi.

original: aa ham zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /🔽drug pa yin no //
analyzed: aa ham zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste / drug pa yin no //
translated: Aham is the sixth, Mahāvajradhara.

original: dus ni drug ste /
analyzed: dus ni drug ste /
translated: The eons are the six.

original: dgun stod dang / dgun smad dang / dpyid pa dang / so ga dang / dbyar dang / ston gyi dus so //
analyzed: dgun stod dang / dgun smad dang / dpyid pa dang / so ga dang / dbyar dang / ston gyi dus so //
translated: winter, early summer, late summer, autumn, spring, and rainy season.

original: gsum 'char zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsum 'char zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
translated: The three rising are the vajra body and so forth.

original: re re zhes bya ba ni drug gi ngo bor shes par bya'o //
analyzed: re re zhes bya ba ni drug gi ngo bor shes par bya'o //
translated: Each should be understood as the nature of the six.

original: rim pa min pa ni rim pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rim pa min pa ni rim pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: The non-sequential is the non-sequential.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs zhes bya bar brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs zhes bya bar brjod pa yin na /
translated: If it is said body, speech, and mind,

original: thugs sku dang de bzhin gsung zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: thugs sku dang de bzhin gsung zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: it is said mind, body, and speech.

original: rgyu ni rang 'dod dgar glegs bam la lta ba rmongs par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu ni rang 'dod dgar glegs bam la lta ba rmongs par bya ba'i don to //
translated: The reason is for the purpose of confusing those who desire to look at the scriptures at will.

original: rdo rje gsum zhes bya ba las zhes pa nas /🔽nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum zhes bya ba las zhes pa nas / nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni //
translated: From vajra three up to vajra three🔽shows

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlab pa bzhugs pa bsdu pa ston to ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlab pa bzhugs pa bsdu pa ston to ;
translated: the existence of the consecration of the body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas.

original: / de ltar bdag la sku byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa byas nas zhes bya ba nas dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: / de ltar bdag la sku byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa byas nas zhes bya ba nas dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Having thus blessed one's body, etc.

original: lha mo'i lus la dgod pa dang / de dang snyom par zhugs pa dang // rjes su chags pa'i sngags rnams dang // mchod pa rnam pa gnyis bstan to//🔽rigs lnga'i cha ni dgod byas la //
analyzed: lha mo'i lus la dgod pa dang / de dang snyom par zhugs pa dang // rjes su chags pa'i sngags rnams dang // mchod pa rnam pa gnyis bstan to// rigs lnga'i cha ni dgod byas la //
translated: The verse beginning Having placed the parts of the five clans refers to the placement of the goddess's body, the union with her, the mantras of passion, and the two kinds of worship.

original: zhes bya ba la rigs lnga ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rigs lnga ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
translated: Having placed the parts of the five clans means that one should place the seed syllables of Vairochana, etc.

original: de'i cha ni sa bon te aom a'a:h'um sv'a h'a de dag dgod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i cha ni sa bon te aom a'a:h'um sv'a h'a de dag dgod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Parts means seeds. The seed syllables are Om, Ah, Hum, Sva, and Ha.

original: yang na rigs lnga'i sa bon gyi tshigs kyi go char byas pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rigs lnga'i sa bon gyi tshigs kyi go char byas pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Or else, one who has made the armor of the seed syllables of the five clans into a garland is so called.

original: de ltar phyi dang nang gi mchod pa bstan nas zhes bya ba nas dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bstan pa dang bcas pa'i rim pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar phyi dang nang gi mchod pa bstan nas zhes bya ba nas dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bstan pa dang bcas pa'i rim pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: Having thus taught the outer and inner offerings, up to “is explained by the intention” teaches the completion stage by the sequence of the teaching.

original: de yang rdo rje 'das pa dang / sems rnam par dag pa dang / rang byin gyis brlab pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa dang / zung du sbyor ba'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje 'das pa dang / sems rnam par dag pa dang / rang byin gyis brlab pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa dang / zung du sbyor ba'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: That is also the nature of the vajra-transcendent, the mind-purification, the self-consecration, the manifest enlightenment, and the union.

original: brtags pa'i rim pas ni byang chub rnyed par dka' bar bstan to //🔽da ni le'u gsum pa las gsungs pa zhes pa nas /
analyzed: brtags pa'i rim pas ni byang chub rnyed par dka' bar bstan to // da ni le'u gsum pa las gsungs pa zhes pa nas /
translated: By the imagined stage, enlightenment is taught to be difficult to attain.

original: nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyi bsgom pa gsum yin te /🔽de yang sna'i rtse mo dang / snying gi snying po dang / gsang ba'i @186a * //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyi bsgom pa gsum yin te / de yang sna'i rtse mo dang / snying gi snying po dang / gsang ba'i @186a * //
translated: Now, from “in the third chapter” up to “is the definitive meaning” teaches the three cultivations of the subtle yoga.

original: snying po rnams la rim bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: snying po rnams la rim bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: That is also to be known in order with the tip of the nose, the heart essence, and the secret essence.

original: da ni sngags dang rlung mnyam par sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: da ni sngags dang rlung mnyam par sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The four stages of the inner maṇḍala are explained from “now, the union of mantra and wind” up to “the explanation of the intention.”

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi rim pa bzhi bsgom pas spro ba'i rim pas sems can gyi don du zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams bstan to //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi rim pa bzhi bsgom pas spro ba'i rim pas sems can gyi don du zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams bstan to //
translated: Now, the four activities of pacifying and so on for the benefit of sentient beings through the stage of emanation by meditating on the four stages of the inner maṇḍala are explained.

original: da ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i sgo nas zhes pa nas /🔽drang ba'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: da ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i sgo nas zhes pa nas / drang ba'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Now, from “through the five qualities of desire” up to “the provisional meaning,”🔽the five amṛtas and the five hooks are enjoyed by the yogi.

original: rnal 'byor ba bdud rtsi lnga dang lcags kyu lnga la nye bar spyod pa'o nye bar spyad na ni rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid thob par bstan to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba bdud rtsi lnga dang lcags kyu lnga la nye bar spyod pa'o nye bar spyad na ni rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid thob par bstan to //
translated: If enjoyed, the state of Mahāvajradhara is attained.🔽From “the explanation of these vajra words” up to “the definitive meaning,”

original: rdo rje tshig 'di dag bshad pa'i zhes pa nas nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa rtogs na /
analyzed: rdo rje tshig 'di dag bshad pa'i zhes pa nas nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa rtogs na /
translated: if the five amṛtas and so on are realized,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rtogs pas de kho na nyid mngon sum du byas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rtogs pas de kho na nyid mngon sum du byas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: the qualities of a buddha are realized, and reality is actualized.

original: 'dir skad cig ni se gol lo //🔽thang cig ni yungs kar lan cig 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir skad cig ni se gol lo // thang cig ni yungs kar lan cig 'khor ba'o //
translated: Here, a moment is a finger snap.🔽A muhūrta is a mustard seed revolving once.

original: yud tsam ni dbugs 'byung rngub gcig go ;
analyzed: yud tsam ni dbugs 'byung rngub gcig go ;
translated: A lava is one exhalation and inhalation.

original: / zhag bco lnga la ni zla ba phyed do //
analyzed: / zhag bco lnga la ni zla ba phyed do //
translated: Fifteen days is one half month.

original: de gnyis ni zla ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ni zla ba'o //
translated: Two of those is one month.

original: zla ba bcu gnyis ni lo gcig go //
analyzed: zla ba bcu gnyis ni lo gcig go //
translated: Twelve months is one year.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni phyag rgya'i yul la rnam par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni phyag rgya'i yul la rnam par shes par bya'o //
translated: Form and so forth should be known as the object of the seal.

original: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pas rnal 'byor pas lhan cig skyes pa'i de kho na nyid thob pa ni /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pas rnal 'byor pas lhan cig skyes pa'i de kho na nyid thob pa ni /
translated: This is taught: The yogin who has entered into the union of method and wisdom and attained the innate reality

original: skad cig gis phyag rgya chen po thob pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: skad cig gis phyag rgya chen po thob pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: attains the great seal in an instant. This is the meaning.

original: sha chen po la sogs pa ni phung po la sogs pa rnam par dag pa phan yon dang bcas pa bstan to //
analyzed: sha chen po la sogs pa ni phung po la sogs pa rnam par dag pa phan yon dang bcas pa bstan to //
translated: The great flesh and so forth teach the purification of the aggregates and so forth with benefits.

original: mtha' drug gis bshad pa le'u drug pa'o /
analyzed: mtha' drug gis bshad pa le'u drug pa'o /
translated: The sixth topic is the sixth chapter.

original: // / de ltar rnal 'byor pa tha mal pa dang zhes pas ni le'u'i skabs ston par byed do //
analyzed: // / de ltar rnal 'byor pa tha mal pa dang zhes pas ni le'u'i skabs ston par byed do //
translated: Thus, the ordinary yogin and so forth shows the context of the chapter.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then,🔽

original: 'di nyid las nges par thob par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni spros pa'i spyod pa bstan te //
analyzed: 'di nyid las nges par thob par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni spros pa'i spyod pa bstan te //
translated: Then, from “Then, having attained the samādhi of the heroes’ abode” up to “one will certainly attain it from this very [tantra]” teaches the elaborate mode of conduct.

original: yan lag drug ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: yan lag drug ces bya ba ni /
translated: The “six limbs” are

original: so sor rjes su spyod pa dang / bsam gtan dang / dbugs ring du rngub pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang ; ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: so sor rjes su spyod pa dang / bsam gtan dang / dbugs ring du rngub pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang ; ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: the individual practice, meditative concentration, long inhalation, retention, recollection, and samādhi.

original: sngags kyi spyod pa ni thun mong gi sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa ni thun mong gi sgrub pa ste /
translated: The mantra conduct is the common practice,

original: bsnyen pa la sogs pa'o //🔽de ltar spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa bstan nas zhes pa nas /
analyzed: bsnyen pa la sogs pa'o // de ltar spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa bstan nas zhes pa nas /
translated: the approach and so forth.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bstan to //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bstan to //
translated: Having taught the elaborate mode of conduct in that way, from “The unelaborate mode of conduct” up to “one should practice the unelaborate mode of conduct” teaches the unelaborate mode of conduct.

original: de la ri las mchod cing zhes pa ni sa'i rnam par dag @186b pa'o ;
analyzed: de la ri las mchod cing zhes pa ni sa'i rnam par dag @186b pa'o ;
translated: Therein, “worship on the mountain” is the purity of the earth element.

original: / mer 'jug pa ni me'i khams rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: / mer 'jug pa ni me'i khams rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: “Entering the fire” is the purity of the fire element.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni chung 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni chung 'jug pa ste /
translated: The word “and so forth” includes “entering the water,”

original: chu'i khams rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i khams rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: which is the purity of the water element.

original: zas bcad pas ni rlung 'khrugs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zas bcad pas ni rlung 'khrugs par 'gyur te /
translated: By fasting, the wind is disturbed,

original: rlung gi khams rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung gi khams rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the wind element is purified.

original: gzhan yang rgas pa dang / na ba bsad pa ni nyon mongs pa las thar par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang rgas pa dang / na ba bsad pa ni nyon mongs pa las thar par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the killing of the aged and the sick is for the sake of liberating them from afflictions.

original: de dag ni mu stegs lta ba ngan pa rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni mu stegs lta ba ngan pa rnams kyi yin no //
translated: These are for the non-Buddhists with bad views.

original: de ltar lus gdung ba'i sgo nas zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de ltar lus gdung ba'i sgo nas zhes pa nas /
translated: Thus, up to by means of tormenting the body and so on,

original: nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: up to this is the definitive meaning.

original: shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bstan te /
analyzed: shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bstan te /
translated: This teaches the extremely unelaborate conduct.

original: der yang drang ba dang nges pa'i don gyi rgyan yin no //
analyzed: der yang drang ba dang nges pa'i don gyi rgyan yin no //
translated: There too, it is an ornament of the provisional and definitive meanings.

original: lha'i rnal 'byor dang mi phyed pa'i 'dod pa zhes pas ni lha dang sngags gnyis tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i rnal 'byor dang mi phyed pa'i 'dod pa zhes pas ni lha dang sngags gnyis tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: Divine yoga and indivisible desire means that the deity and mantra are non-dual.

original: 'das pa'i ye shes can yang zhes pa nas //
analyzed: 'das pa'i ye shes can yang zhes pa nas //
translated: Endowed with transcendent wisdom and so on,

original: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pas sngon gyis sangs rgyas kyang grub par bstan to //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pas sngon gyis sangs rgyas kyang grub par bstan to //
translated: up to this is not the intended explanation teaches that even the previous Buddhas attained accomplishment through the unelaborate conduct.

original: de rnams kyis rten par gyur pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de rnams kyis rten par gyur pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Those are called “the bases.”

original: spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'i zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzugs la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa dang / lha mo'i ngo bor shes nas rnal 'byor pas nye bar spyad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'i zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzugs la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa dang / lha mo'i ngo bor shes nas rnal 'byor pas nye bar spyad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: From “the yoga of elaborations” up to “the yoga of elaborations” explains that the yogi should know the Tathāgata and the goddesses as the nature of form and so forth and should enjoy them.

original: spros pa bstan pa yin no //🔽gzugs la zhes pa nas 'di ni spros pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni ye shes gsum rnam par 'byed pa'i ngo bo la brten nas /
analyzed: spros pa bstan pa yin no // gzugs la zhes pa nas 'di ni spros pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni ye shes gsum rnam par 'byed pa'i ngo bo la brten nas /
translated: This is the explanation of elaborations.

original: rnal 'byor pa gzugs la sogs pa la nye bar spyod pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gzugs la sogs pa la nye bar spyod pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa'o //
translated: From “form” up to “this is nonelaboration” explains that the yogi, based on the nature of the differentiation of the three exalted wisdoms, enjoys form and so forth and attains the state of Mahāvajradhara.

original: de nyid spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bstan to //
translated: This is the explanation of the nonelaborated enjoyment.

original: brgya drug cu'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni de las shes rab kyi ngo bo sum cu rtsa gsum thabs kyi ngo bo bzhi bcu ma rig pa'i ngo bo bdun /
analyzed: brgya drug cu'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni de las shes rab kyi ngo bo sum cu rtsa gsum thabs kyi ngo bo bzhi bcu ma rig pa'i ngo bo bdun /
translated: “The nature of one hundred and sixty” means that from that, the nature of wisdom is thirty-three, the nature of method is forty, and the nature of ignorance is seven.

original: de dag bsdoms na brgyad cu ste /
analyzed: de dag bsdoms na brgyad cu ste /
translated: When those are combined, they are one hundred and sixty.

original: nyin zhag gcig la brgya drug cur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyin zhag gcig la brgya drug cur 'gyur ro //
translated: In one day and night, they become one hundred and sixty.

original: de dag gi ngo bo nyid ni 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo nyid ni 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Their nature is clear light.

original: gzugs la zhes bya ba nas mthar thug pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rang bzhin gyi 'od gsal ba la zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bstan to //🔽da ni rjes su dran pa drug ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs la zhes bya ba nas mthar thug pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rang bzhin gyi 'od gsal ba la zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bstan to // da ni rjes su dran pa drug ces bya ba nas /
translated: From “In form” up to “ultimate” teaches the conduct of complete nonelaboration by means of the characteristic of entering into the clear light of nature.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa lnga bstan to //🔽de ltar rjes su dran pa drug gi sgo nas zhes pa nas /🔽dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis @187a * //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa lnga bstan to // de ltar rjes su dran pa drug gi sgo nas zhes pa nas / dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis @187a * //
translated: Now, from “six recollections” up to “intentional explanation” teaches the five stages of vajra repetition and so on.

original: ni rigs lnga gtso bor byas pa'i sgo nas dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa bstan to //
analyzed: ni rigs lnga gtso bor byas pa'i sgo nas dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, from “by means of the six recollections” up to “nonintentional explanation” teaches the pledge seal and union by means of the five families as the main practice.

original: spyod pa rnam pa gsum ni 'di nyid kyi yan lag tu gyur pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa rnam pa gsum ni 'di nyid kyi yan lag tu gyur pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The three types of conduct are taught as branches of that.

original: sngar gsungs pa'i rjes su dran pa drug ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa'i rjes su dran pa drug ces bya ba nas /
translated: The six recollections that were previously mentioned,

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: explained with an intention,

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po nas ;
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po nas ;
translated: from Great Vajradhara

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i spro ba bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i spro ba bstan to //
translated: up to the display of the five Tathagatas.

original: drug pa'i rjes su dran pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyis skyon bdud rtsis tshim par bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: drug pa'i rjes su dran pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyis skyon bdud rtsis tshim par bya bar bstan to //
translated: The sixth recollection is the teaching on the satisfaction of the faults of samadhi with the nectar.

original: sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba dang zhes pa nas /🔽'dod pa'i dbang phyug gsal bar ston pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar gyis sku la sogs pa rjes su dran pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba dang zhes pa nas / 'dod pa'i dbang phyug gsal bar ston pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar gyis sku la sogs pa rjes su dran pa'i sgo nas /
translated: The application and post-application up to

original: don dam pa'i bden pa la 'jug pa bstan to //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa la 'jug pa bstan to //
translated: clearly shows the lord of desire teaches the entry into ultimate truth through the recollection of the body and so forth.

original: lnga bcu'i phung po la sogs pa btung bas zhes bya ba la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: lnga bcu'i phung po la sogs pa btung bas zhes bya ba la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The drinking of the aggregate of fifty and so forth means this:

original: de la gzugs ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bye brag gis rnam pa nyi shu'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bye brag gis rnam pa nyi shu'o //
translated: Therein, form is twenty types by the distinctions of color and shape.

original: tshor ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa yang dag par reg pa'i dbye bas bco brgyad do //
analyzed: tshor ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa yang dag par reg pa'i dbye bas bco brgyad do //
translated: Feeling is eighteenfold, by the division of pleasure, etc., and by the division of the correct experience of form, etc.

original: 'du shes ni gcig 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: 'du shes ni gcig 'ba' zhig go //
translated: Perception is one only.

original: 'du byed ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i dbye bas gsum mo //
analyzed: 'du byed ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i dbye bas gsum mo //
translated: Disposition is threefold, by the division of virtue, nonvirtue, and neutral.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas ni brgyad do //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas ni brgyad do //
translated: It is eightfold, by the division of the store-consciousness, etc.

original: de rnams bsdus pa ni lnga bcu'o //🔽padma spyan ma la sogs pa rigs bzhi'o zhes bya ba ni padma can ma ni padma rab tu yangs pa can ma'o //
analyzed: de rnams bsdus pa ni lnga bcu'o // padma spyan ma la sogs pa rigs bzhi'o zhes bya ba ni padma can ma ni padma rab tu yangs pa can ma'o //
translated: The total is fifty.🔽Lotus-eyed, etc., are the four families.🔽The lotus-eyed is the one with a very wide lotus.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dung can ma ni padma yon po can no //🔽autpala can ma ni padma cung zad ma'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dung can ma ni padma yon po can no // autpala can ma ni padma cung zad ma'o //
translated: The conch-eyed is the one with a crooked lotus.🔽The blue-lotus-eyed is the one with a small lotus.

original: ri dvags can ma ni padma tha mal pa can ma'o //
analyzed: ri dvags can ma ni padma tha mal pa can ma'o //
translated: The deer-eyed is the one with an ordinary lotus.

original: ri dvags ma dang / rgod ma ma dang / glang ma ste /🔽bud med kyi rigs rnam pa gsum mo ;
analyzed: ri dvags ma dang / rgod ma ma dang / glang ma ste / bud med kyi rigs rnam pa gsum mo ;
translated: The doe, the mare, and the elephant are🔽the three types of women.

original: / skyes pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: / skyes pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The man is also of three types:

original: ri bong dang / khyu mchog dang / rta'i rigs te rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: ri bong dang / khyu mchog dang / rta'i rigs te rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The three types are the rabbit, the bull, and the horse.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa'i bstan bcos kyi lugs so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa'i bstan bcos kyi lugs so //
translated: This is the system of the treatise on desire.

original: der byas pa'i rab tu dbye ba'i las kyis so zhes bya ba ni dper na padma can ma'i padma yangs pa bzlog nas /
analyzed: der byas pa'i rab tu dbye ba'i las kyis so zhes bya ba ni dper na padma can ma'i padma yangs pa bzlog nas /
translated: By the action of the division there, as in the case of the lotus of a lotus-woman, the lotus is opened.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i rtags phra ba yod na dog par byas te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i rtags phra ba yod na dog par byas te /
translated: If the subtle sign of the yogi is present, it is made narrow.

original: de ltar las bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar las bya'o //
translated: Thus the action is done.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi padma can dog par yod na yangs par bya'o zhes brtag par bya'o //🔽rjes su dran pa'i 'bras bu bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi padma can dog par yod na yangs par bya'o zhes brtag par bya'o // rjes su dran pa'i 'bras bu bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In the same way, if the lotus of wisdom is narrow, it should be made wide.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rnal 'byor pa ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i bdag nyid chen @187b po'i sngags pa dang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i grub pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rnal 'byor pa ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i bdag nyid chen @187b po'i sngags pa dang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i grub pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: In order to teach the result of recollection, from “thus” up to “the literal meaning” teaches the great self-nature of the mantra practitioner who has attained concentration and the mundane and supramundane accomplishments.

original: mtha' drug gis bshad pa'i le'u bdun pa'o /
analyzed: mtha' drug gis bshad pa'i le'u bdun pa'o /
translated: This is the seventh chapter explained by the six parameters.

original: // / de ltar spyod pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni le'u'i skabs ston pa yin no //
analyzed: // / de ltar spyod pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni le'u'i skabs ston pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the yogi who abides in such conduct and so forth show the section of the chapter.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, and so forth up to

original: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: intentional explanation.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po la rin chen 'byung ldan gyi yon tan yang dag pa'i tshogs yongs su brjod pa'i sgo nas bstod par byed par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po la rin chen 'byung ldan gyi yon tan yang dag pa'i tshogs yongs su brjod pa'i sgo nas bstod par byed par ston pa yin no //
translated: This shows that Ratnasaṃbhava praises Great Vajradhara by expressing his perfect qualities.

original: 'dir ni drang ba dang nges pa'i don gyi rgyan gyi don yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni drang ba dang nges pa'i don gyi rgyan gyi don yod pa yin no //
translated: Here, the meaning of the ornaments of the provisional and definitive meanings exists.🔽The supreme tathāgata, and so forth up to

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchog ces bya ba nas dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchog ces bya ba nas dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: intentional explanation,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa'i mchod pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa'i mchod pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: shows that the Blessed One taught the unsurpassed worship.

original: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In order to teach that, and so forth up to

original: yang dgongs par bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phyag rgya chen po'i byin gyis brlab pa bstan to //
analyzed: yang dgongs par bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phyag rgya chen po'i byin gyis brlab pa bstan to //
translated: The passage up to explained as the intention teaches the blessing of the great seal.

original: shin tu yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang zhes bya ba nas /🔽ji lta ji lta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: shin tu yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang zhes bya ba nas / ji lta ji lta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: The passage beginning extremely transcendent up to just as it is teaches

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i gnas dang / phyag rgya'i rnam par dag pa bstan to //🔽ji srid du de ltar byas pa'i zhes pa nas /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i gnas dang / phyag rgya'i rnam par dag pa bstan to // ji srid du de ltar byas pa'i zhes pa nas /
translated: the place of the yogi who abides in the creation stage and the purity of the seal.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: The passage beginning for as long as one does it in this way up to just as it is teaches

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku lha mo bzhis bskor ba slob ma dbang bskur ba'i don du gsungs pa yin no //🔽da ni rnal 'byor gnyi ga'i zhes pa nas /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku lha mo bzhis bskor ba slob ma dbang bskur ba'i don du gsungs pa yin no // da ni rnal 'byor gnyi ga'i zhes pa nas /
translated: the form of Great Vajradhara surrounded by the four goddesses for the purpose of the disciple's empowerment.

original: nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rim pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor pa'i mchod pa 'dra ba'i rim pa bstan to //🔽gang zhig rlung ni bcur grags pa //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rim pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor pa'i mchod pa 'dra ba'i rim pa bstan to //🔽gang zhig rlung ni bcur grags pa //
translated: Now, the passage beginning both yogas up to definitive meaning teaches the sequence of the offerings of the yogi of the two stages.🔽 The passage beginning the ten winds up to just as it is teaches the sequence of the offerings of the yogi of the two stages.🔽 The passage beginning the ten winds up to just as it is teaches the sequence of the offerings of the yogi of the two stages.

original: de ni padma autpala ming //
analyzed: de ni padma autpala ming //
translated: It is called Padma and Utpala,

original: zhes bya ba'i grang ba'i reg pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i grang ba'i reg pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is endowed with the cold touch.

original: de nyid ces grags rdo rje gsum //
analyzed: de nyid ces grags rdo rje gsum //
translated: That is the three vajras, known as the three suchnesses.

original: dz'a ti gcig po gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: dz'a ti gcig po gsum du 'dod //
translated: The one jati is considered to be the three.

original: ces bya ba la dz'a ti ni sna ma'i me tog ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la dz'a ti ni sna ma'i me tog ste /
translated: Jati is the jasmine flower.

original: de gcig po dri zhim pas yid 'phrog par byed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de gcig po dri zhim pas yid 'phrog par byed pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as that one, by its sweet scent, captivates the mind,

original: sku la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid shes pa ni rdo rje gsum yin no //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid shes pa ni rdo rje gsum yin no //
translated: so also the three vajras are the suchness of the body, etc.

original: de bzhin du kar ni ka la sogs pa ni lcug ma'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du kar ni ka la sogs pa ni lcug ma'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, karnikara, etc. are the nature of twigs,

original: sgeg pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / skyes bu sgeg pa rnams dga' bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgeg pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / skyes bu sgeg pa rnams dga' bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are endowed with grace, and because they delight the graceful people.

original: sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa'i rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa'i rnam grangs yin no //
translated: They are the synonyms of Buddhalocanā, etc.

original: da ni rnal 'byor pa @188a * //
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor pa @188a * //
translated: Now, the yogi

original: gnyi ga'i thun mong gi zhes pa nas zhes bya ba'i bar du zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mos pa'i bye brag gis de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa bstan to //🔽de ltar bla ma'i bya ba bstan pa'i 'og tu zhes bya ba nas /🔽bsam gtan gyis kyang thams cad bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phyi rol dang / gsang ba'i mchod pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang slob dpon la slob mas bya ba gal te med na bsgom par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i thun mong gi zhes pa nas zhes bya ba'i bar du zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mos pa'i bye brag gis de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa bstan to // de ltar bla ma'i bya ba bstan pa'i 'og tu zhes bya ba nas / bsam gtan gyis kyang thams cad bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phyi rol dang / gsang ba'i mchod pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang slob dpon la slob mas bya ba gal te med na bsgom par bya ba bstan to //
translated: The passage from both up to one should meditate on the mandala of the five Tathagatas teaches the meditation on the mandala of the five Tathagatas by way of the particular faith.🔽After the teaching on the duties of the guru, the passage from thus up to one should generate all by means of contemplation teaches the meditation on the external and secret offerings and on the mandala and the guru if the disciple is unable to perform them.

original: de ltar slob mas mchod pa'i yo byad thams cad bsags zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de ltar slob mas mchod pa'i yo byad thams cad bsags zhes pa nas /
translated: After the teaching on the duties of the disciple, the passage from thus, the disciple, having gathered all the offering articles up to one should not give the initiation teaches the initiation.

original: de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa byas te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar bsgom pa'i sngon du 'gro bas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bsdu bar byas nas rdo rje slob ma dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs par bstan to //🔽chags pa dang / chags pa dang bral ba zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa byas te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de ltar bsgom pa'i sngon du 'gro bas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bsdu bar byas nas rdo rje slob ma dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs par bstan to // chags pa dang / chags pa dang bral ba zhes pa nas /
translated: The passage up to having made the offering of reality teaches that, having gathered the Tathagatas in front of oneself by the preliminaries of such meditation, the vajra disciple enters into union with the pledge seal.

original: slob ma dbang bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni slob ma la gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba sbyin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: slob ma dbang bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni slob ma la gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba sbyin par bstan pa'o //
translated: The passage from passion and non-passion up to the disciple should be empowered teaches the bestowal of the secret empowerment on the disciple.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad tshim par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa tsam ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad tshim par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa tsam ste /
translated: The phrase all Tathagatas should be satisfied is merely an illustration.

original: kye ma'o bde ba che zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: kye ma'o bde ba che zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should also say Oh, great bliss!

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du zhes bya ba ni lung tshad mar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du zhes bya ba ni lung tshad mar byas pa yin no //
translated: The phrase as the Bhagavat said is a scriptural citation.

original: 'di ni de zhes bya ba ni zhes pa nas /
analyzed: 'di ni de zhes bya ba ni zhes pa nas /
translated: The phrase this is he up to the disciple should be empowered teaches the bestowal of the wisdom-knowledge empowerment on the disciple.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'i 'bras bu bstan no //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'i 'bras bu bstan no //
translated: The phrase just as it is indicates the result of the secret empowerment.

original: mtha' drug gis bshad pa'i le'u brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: mtha' drug gis bshad pa'i le'u brgyad pa'o /
translated: This is the eighth chapter of the explanation by means of the six parameters.

original: // / dbang bskur ba rdzogs pas zhes pa la sogs pa ni le'u'i skabs ston pa yin no //🔽de nas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: // / dbang bskur ba rdzogs pas zhes pa la sogs pa ni le'u'i skabs ston pa yin no // de nas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The phrase the empowerment conferred and so forth indicates the topic of the chapter.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po chos ston pa rtsom pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po chos ston pa rtsom pa yin no //
translated: The phrase then and so forth up to just as it is indicates the teaching of the Dharma by Bhagavān Mahāvajradhara.

original: nam mkha' bzhi'i bdag nyid can gyi zhes pa ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhi'i bdag nyid can gyi zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase the nature of the four space refers to

original: stong pa dang / shin tu stong pa dang / stong pa chen po dang / thams cad stong pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa dang / shin tu stong pa dang / stong pa chen po dang / thams cad stong pa'o //
translated: emptiness, great emptiness, supreme emptiness, and universal emptiness.

original: yang na lkog ma la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: yang na lkog ma la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi rnams so //
translated: Alternatively, it refers to the four maṇḍalas of the throat and so forth.

original: yang na padma'i nang na gnas pa'i rtsa rgyun phra mo'i rtse mo shar la sogs pa'i phyogs la rim bzhin gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yang na padma'i nang na gnas pa'i rtsa rgyun phra mo'i rtse mo shar la sogs pa'i phyogs la rim bzhin gnas pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, it refers to the tips of the subtle channels located in the petals of the lotus, which are located in the east and so forth.

original: lnga ji ltar der yod pa yin yang gcig ni thams cad du khyab pa'i phyir ma brjod do //
analyzed: lnga ji ltar der yod pa yin yang gcig ni thams cad du khyab pa'i phyir ma brjod do //
translated: Although there are five, one is not mentioned because it pervades all.

original: de yang ji skad du rdo rje bdud rtsi'i rgyud las /
analyzed: de yang ji skad du rdo rje bdud rtsi'i rgyud las /
translated: And that is as stated in the Vajra Amṛta Tantra:

original: bha ga yi ni stong pa gang //
analyzed: bha ga yi ni stong pa gang //
translated: The emptiness of the bhaga

original: nam mkha' lnga yis brgyan pa yin //
analyzed: nam mkha' lnga yis brgyan pa yin //
translated: is adorned with the five spaces.

original: snying po ze bdag ldan @188b zhing ;
analyzed: snying po ze bdag ldan @188b zhing ;
translated: Endowed with the essence and stamen,

original: /'dab ma brgyad kyis rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: /'dab ma brgyad kyis rnam par brgyan //
translated: it is adorned with eight petals.

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As stated.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus gnas pa //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus gnas pa //
translated: Abiding in the middle of the realm of space

original: zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas /
translated: up to

original: gzhan du sdigs pa'i phul yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du sdigs pa'i phul yin no //
translated: the supreme of all wrathful ones.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis ni mi bskyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis mngon spyod bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i bar gyis ni mi bskyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis mngon spyod bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the practice of wrathful activity by means of the meditative concentration of Akṣobhya.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni zhes pa nas /
translated: Then, beginning with “Then, the Blessed One, the Great Joy, entered the meditative concentration called ‘the wrathful one who burns all the obstructors of the maṇḍala.’”

original: ser sna can 'jungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis sngags dang / phyag rgya'i rim pas gzhan gyi rdzas 'gugs pa bstan to //🔽de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhes pa nas /🔽sgrub pa nyams su blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis /🔽bud med thams cad la 'dod pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: ser sna can 'jungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis sngags dang / phyag rgya'i rim pas gzhan gyi rdzas 'gugs pa bstan to // de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhes pa nas / sgrub pa nyams su blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis / bud med thams cad la 'dod pa'i sgo nas /
translated: The passage from the miser, the greedy one up to and so on teaches the summoning of another's wealth by means of the stage of mantra and seal of the Vairocana samadhi.🔽Then, and so on up to one should practice the means of attainment teaches the state of being a lord of all desires in all ways by means of the Amoghasiddhi samadhi, through desire for all women.🔽Then, and so on up to one should practice the means of attainment teaches the state of being a lord of all desires in all ways by means of the Amitabha samadhi, through desire for all women.

original: thams cad du 'dod pa'i dbang phyug tu ston pa yin no //🔽de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: thams cad du 'dod pa'i dbang phyug tu ston pa yin no // de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then, and so on up to one should practice the means of attainment teaches the state of being a lord of all desires in all ways by means of the Akshobhya samadhi, through desire for all women.🔽Then, and so on up to one should practice the means of attainment teaches the state of being a lord of all desires in all ways by means of the Ratnasambhava samadhi, through desire for all women.🔽Then, and so on up to one should practice the means of attainment teaches the state of being a lord of all desires in all ways by means of the Vairocana samadhi, through desire for all women.🔽Then, and so on up to one should practice the means of attainment teaches the state of being a lord of all desires in all ways by means of the Amoghasiddhi samadhi, through desire for all women.

original: rtag par brdzun du smra bar bya zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni don yod grub pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo bstan to //
analyzed: rtag par brdzun du smra bar bya zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni don yod grub pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo bstan to //
translated: Then, and so on up to one should practice the means of attainment teaches the state of being a lord of all desires in all ways by means of the Amitabha samadhi, through desire for all women.🔽Then, and so on up to one should practice the means of attainment teaches the state of being a lord of all desires in all ways by means of the Akshobhya samadhi, through desire for all women.🔽Then, and so on up to one should practice the means of attainment teaches the state of being a lord of all desires in all ways by means of the Ratnasambhava samadhi, through desire for all women.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhes pa nas /
translated: Then, etc.

original: drang ba'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ting nge 'dzin gyis /
analyzed: drang ba'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ting nge 'dzin gyis /
translated: up to interpretable meaning, shows that by the samadhi of Ratnasaṃbhava,

original: ngag rtsub pa'i thabs kyi bdag dang gzhan rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid du bsgrub par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ngag rtsub pa'i thabs kyi bdag dang gzhan rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid du bsgrub par bstan pa yin no //
translated: one accomplishes oneself and others in the state of Great Vajradhara by the method of harsh speech.

original: rtsub pa'i ngag ni /
analyzed: rtsub pa'i ngag ni /
translated: Harsh speech is

original: 'di ni khyod kyi dmyal ba'i chu //🔽dam tshig 'das na bsreg par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ni khyod kyi dmyal ba'i chu // dam tshig 'das na bsreg par 'gyur //
translated: this is your hell water,

original: zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa yin no //
translated: if you transgress your pledge it will burn you.

original: yang ba ma spangs pas 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang ba ma spangs pas 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And because one does not die without having given up what is light.

original: ngag rtsub pa yin na yang rtsub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ngag rtsub pa yin na yang rtsub pa ma yin te /
translated: And even though it is harsh speech, it is not harsh,

original: nang na phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa byang chub sems dpa' la yod pas so //
analyzed: nang na phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa byang chub sems dpa' la yod pas so //
translated: because it is present in the bodhisattva who has the inner thought of benefit.

original: lung gis bshad pa brjod par bya ste zhes pa nas /
analyzed: lung gis bshad pa brjod par bya ste zhes pa nas /
translated: The explanation by scripture should be stated, from “it is said” up to

original: nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dam tshig lnga tshigs su bcad pas bstan to //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dam tshig lnga tshigs su bcad pas bstan to //
translated: The passage from “the nature of the five pledges” up to “definitive meaning” teaches the five pledges that are the nature of entering into clear light.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i 'khor gyi nang nas zhes pa nas ma gsung cig ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni ma 'ongs pa'i sems can gyi khams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas ma rtogs pa lta bu'i tshul gyis rdo rje 'chang chen po'i🔽bka' la ma gus pa ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i 'khor gyi nang nas zhes pa nas ma gsung cig ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni ma 'ongs pa'i sems can gyi khams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpas ma rtogs pa lta bu'i tshul gyis rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bka' la ma gus pa ston pa yin no //
translated: The passage from “in the midst of the retinue of Great Vajradhara” up to “do not speak” teaches the disrespect for the word of Great Vajradhara by the bodhisattvas in the manner of not understanding, in order to care for the realm of sentient beings in the future.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis smras pa gsan nas zhes bya ba @189a * //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis smras pa gsan nas zhes bya ba @189a * //
translated: Having heard the speech of the bodhisattvas just explained, the Bhagavān, the Great Joy,

original: nas ; tshe 'di nyid la rang gi ngo bo nyid rje ba yin pas so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i spyod pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nas ; tshe 'di nyid la rang gi ngo bo nyid rje ba yin pas so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i spyod pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: By in this very life, one's own nature is taken up is taught the conduct of the generation stage and perfection stage that the Tathagatas generate in the Bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar spyod pa gnyis kyis bstan pa bshad nas zhes bya ba nas /🔽de dag rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bden pa gnyis gnyis su med pa'i dpes dam tshig gi de kho na nyid de bzhin gshegs pas bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa gnyis kyis bstan pa bshad nas zhes bya ba nas / de dag rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bden pa gnyis gnyis su med pa'i dpes dam tshig gi de kho na nyid de bzhin gshegs pas bstan to //
translated: Having explained the two conducts in that way, the Tathagata taught the reality of the commitments by the example of the non-duality of the two truths.

original: de ltar chos thams cad kyi bden pa zhes pa nas /🔽rdzogs pa la ni 'jug pa dang ldang ba med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /🔽gtsub shing dang gtsub stan gyi dpes dngos po med par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad kyi bden pa zhes pa nas / rdzogs pa la ni 'jug pa dang ldang ba med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni / gtsub shing dang gtsub stan gyi dpes dngos po med par bstan to //
translated: Thus, the reality of all phenomena up to the reality of the Tathagata is taught by the example of the non-duality of the two truths.🔽Thus, the reality of the Tathagata up to the reality of the commitments is taught by the example of the non-duality of the two truths.🔽Thus, the reality of the commitments up to the reality of the Dharma is taught by the example of the non-duality of the two truths.🔽Thus, the reality of the Dharma up to the reality of the Sangha is taught by the example of the non-duality of the two truths.🔽Thus, the reality of the Sangha up to the reality of the Tathagata is taught by the example of the non-duality of the two truths.🔽Thus, the reality of the Tathagata up to the reality of the commitments is taught by the example of the non-duality of the two truths.🔽Thus, the reality of the commitments up to the reality of the Dharma is taught by the example of the non-duality of the two truths.🔽Thus, the reality of the Dharma up to the reality of the Sangha is taught by the example of the non-duality of the two truths.🔽Thus, the reality of the Sangha up to the reality of the Tathagata is taught by the example of the non-duality of the two truths.🔽Thus, the reality of the Tathagata up to the reality of the commitments is taught by the example of the non-duality of the two truths.

original: de ltar mchog tu zab pa'i chos nyid thos shing zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de ltar mchog tu zab pa'i chos nyid thos shing zhes pa nas /
translated: Thus, the reality of the commitments up to the reality of the Dharma is taught by the example of the non-duality of the two truths.

original: de ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: This is wonderful!

original: byang chub sems dpas de kho na nyid rtogs pa skyo bas de la dad pa skyes pa'i tshig tu brjod pa bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de kho na nyid rtogs pa skyo bas de la dad pa skyes pa'i tshig tu brjod pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the words of faith in that, by the Bodhisattva's realization of reality, he is not discouraged.

original: don dam pa ni 'od gsal ba'o zhes pa nas /🔽dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: don dam pa ni 'od gsal ba'o zhes pa nas / dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: The ultimate is clear light.

original: le'u don dang ldan pa'i ming bstan to //
analyzed: le'u don dang ldan pa'i ming bstan to //
translated: This shows the name of the chapter which has the meaning.

original: mtha' drug gis bshad pa'i le'u dgu pa'o /
analyzed: mtha' drug gis bshad pa'i le'u dgu pa'o /
translated: This is the ninth chapter of the explanation by means of the six limits.

original: // / sgrub pa mchog dang tha mal pa la gnas shing zhes pa la sogs pas ni le'u'i skabs ston to //
analyzed: // / sgrub pa mchog dang tha mal pa la gnas shing zhes pa la sogs pas ni le'u'i skabs ston to //
translated: The words abiding in the supreme and ordinary practice and so forth show the topic of the chapter.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa le'u bcu pa zhes bya ba nas /🔽rab tu bstan du gsol zhes gsol ba btab pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa le'u bcu pa zhes bya ba nas / rab tu bstan du gsol zhes gsol ba btab pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: The words then and so forth, up to the tenth chapter called show the name of the chapter.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la chos bshad par gsol ba btab par bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la chos bshad par gsol ba btab par bstan to //
translated: The words the request, 'Please teach!' show the request of the Tathagatas to the Lord to teach the Dharma.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas zhus pa'i 'og tu'o zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas zhus pa'i 'og tu'o zhes pa nas /
translated: Then, after the request,

original: de la gzhol par mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de la gzhol par mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: up to “for the sake of engaging in that,”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal bar ston pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal bar ston pa yin no //
translated: it shows the Blessed One’s response.

original: lus dang sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: lus dang sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: As for “body and mind,” etc.,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: up to “the Tathāgatas said this,”

original: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i sgo nas lan bka' stsal ba bstan to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i sgo nas lan bka' stsal ba bstan to //
translated: it shows the response by way of entering into meditative concentration.🔽As for “the Blessed One,” etc.,

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa la zhes bya ba nas 'og nas bshad pa 'di gsungs pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rnal 'byor ba sngags la gzhol ba rnams la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa la zhes bya ba nas 'og nas bshad pa 'di gsungs pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rnal 'byor ba sngags la gzhol ba rnams la /
translated: up to “this was said,” it shows the Blessed One’s beginning to speak the mantra for the sake of the yogins who are devoted to mantra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su gzung ba'i phyir /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyi @189b sngags gsung bar rtsom pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su gzung ba'i phyir /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyi @189b sngags gsung bar rtsom pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: for the sake of the Tathāgatas’ protection.

original: de gang zhe na zhes pa nas gyur pa zhes bya ba ni thob pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de gang zhe na zhes pa nas gyur pa zhes bya ba ni thob pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Up to: attainment is called “transformation.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid chen po bshad pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid chen po bshad pas /
translated: By explaining the greatness of the Blessed One’s three syllables,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can thams cad rjes su gzung pa'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dran pas brgyal bar gyur pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can thams cad rjes su gzung pa'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dran pas brgyal bar gyur pa bstan to //
translated: it shows that the Tathāgatas and Bodhisattvas, for the sake of caring for all sentient beings, are overcome by the recollection of the Tathāgatas and Bodhisattvas.

original: bud med dang / skyes pa dang / ma ning gi ngo bo nyid kyis yi ge rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bud med dang / skyes pa dang / ma ning gi ngo bo nyid kyis yi ge rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The nature of the syllables as female, male, and neuter

original: aa'i tshar dang ka'i tshar gyi yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa dgu po'i ma mo de la /
analyzed: aa'i tshar dang ka'i tshar gyi yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa dgu po'i ma mo de la /
translated: is the mother of the forty-nine syllables of the Ā group and the KA group.

original: sde tshan brgyad la dbyangs kyi yi ge sde tshan gcig / ka nas me'i bar la ni sde tshan lnga'o //
analyzed: sde tshan brgyad la dbyangs kyi yi ge sde tshan gcig / ka nas me'i bar la ni sde tshan lnga'o //
translated: Among the eight classes, the vowels are one class, and from KA to MA are five classes.

original: mthar gnas dang / ausma na da'i sde tshan ni gnyis te brgyad do //
analyzed: mthar gnas dang / ausma na da'i sde tshan ni gnyis te brgyad do //
translated: The classes of ANUŚĀRĀ and USMAN are two, making eight.

original: kha cig ni dbyangs kyi yi ge la thung ba dang ring ba'i sde tshan gnyis yod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni dbyangs kyi yi ge la thung ba dang ring ba'i sde tshan gnyis yod de /
translated: Some say that the vowels are divided into two groups, short and long.

original: sde tshan brgyad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sde tshan brgyad do zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus there are eight groups.

original: de la cha rnam pa bcu drug ni yi ge dang po la bsdus pa yin te aa'o //
analyzed: de la cha rnam pa bcu drug ni yi ge dang po la bsdus pa yin te aa'o //
translated: The sixteen parts are included in the first letter, A.

original: sde tshan lnga ni dang po'i yi ge la bsdus te ka'o //
analyzed: sde tshan lnga ni dang po'i yi ge la bsdus te ka'o //
translated: The five groups are included in the first letter, Ka.

original: mtha' gnas dang dro ba ni dang po'i yi ge la bsdus te ya dang sha'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnas dang dro ba ni dang po'i yi ge la bsdus te ya dang sha'o //
translated: The final letters, Ya and Sha, are included in the first letter, Ya.

original: yi ge bzhi po 'di dag ni //
analyzed: yi ge bzhi po 'di dag ni //
translated: These four letters

original: yi ge gsum gyi nang du 'dus te /
analyzed: yi ge gsum gyi nang du 'dus te /
translated: are included in three letters.

original: yi ge aa dang ka dang ya'i nang du'o //
analyzed: yi ge aa dang ka dang ya'i nang du'o //
translated: They are included in the letters A, Ka, and Ya.

original: de la pa'i sde tshan gyi yi ge ni bud med kyi ngo bo'o //🔽ka'i sde tshan gyi yi ge ni skyes pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de la pa'i sde tshan gyi yi ge ni bud med kyi ngo bo'o // ka'i sde tshan gyi yi ge ni skyes pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The letters of the Pa group are of the nature of women.🔽The letters of the Ka group are of the nature of men.

original: ya la sogs pa ni ma ning gi yi ge'o //🔽dbyangs kyi yi ge'i sde tshan ni yi ge aa yis bsdus so //
analyzed: ya la sogs pa ni ma ning gi yi ge'o // dbyangs kyi yi ge'i sde tshan ni yi ge aa yis bsdus so //
translated: The letters Ya and so forth are of the nature of eunuchs.🔽The group of vowel letters is included in the letter A.

original: gsal byed kyi yi ge'i sde tshan ni yi ge h'um gis bsdus so //
analyzed: gsal byed kyi yi ge'i sde tshan ni yi ge h'um gis bsdus so //
translated: The group of consonant letters is included in the letter Ha.

original: ya la sogs pa ni yi ge aom gyis bsdus so //
analyzed: ya la sogs pa ni yi ge aom gyis bsdus so //
translated: Ya and so forth are included in the letter Om.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir shes rab dang / thabs dang gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyi yi ge gsum yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir shes rab dang / thabs dang gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyi yi ge gsum yin no //
translated: For this very reason, the three letters are the essence of wisdom, method, and both.

original: de nas dran pa'i 'og tu zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas dran pa'i 'og tu zhes pa nas /
translated: Then, after mindfulness, up to🔽he spoke thus.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal ba'o zhes bya ba'i bra gyis ni /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal ba'o zhes bya ba'i bra gyis ni /
translated: By this passage,

analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen pos sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid sprul nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs la sogs pa'i mthus blangs nas /

analyzed: bdag nyid mthu thams cad dang ldan par bstan to //

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi nus pa zhes bya ba na /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi nus pa zhes bya ba na /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku la sogs pa'i sa bon rang gi 'od zer gyis phog pa las /

analyzed: de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyis 'od zer thams cad drangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the light rays that arise from that draw in all light rays.

original: de ltar bsdus @190a * //
analyzed: de ltar bsdus @190a * //
translated: Thus, having gathered🔽them into one,

analyzed: pa'i dkyil 'khor mngon par bsdus pa zhes pa nas /

analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid thugs la bskul ba'i sgo nas /

analyzed: thugs yang dag par bskul ba'i cho ga zhes pa nas /

analyzed: rjes su 'dzin par mdzad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sgrub pa po la sangs rgyas kyi dus kyi tshad la brten nas rjes su bzung par mdzad pa bstan to //
translated: The section from the maṇḍala of the three beings up to the method of accomplishment indicates🔽that the maṇḍala of

analyzed: le lo byas na dus 'das pa 'bras bu med par bstan to //

analyzed: rang byin gyis brlab pa dang / 'od gsal ba'i rim pa dag gi rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas thugs bskul bar bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: de ltar thabs dang bcas pa ni // zhes pa nas /
translated: up to

analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: “intentional explanation” teaches that the yogi who abides in the completion stage of the stages of self-consecration and clear light should arouse the mind.

analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i spro ba'i rim pas 'jug par bstan to //
translated: The entry into the yoga of the perfection stage is taught by the process of emanation.

original: mtha' drug gis bshad pa le'u bcu pa'o /
analyzed: mtha' drug gis bshad pa le'u bcu pa'o /
