analyzed: khyab 'jug gi dam tshig go zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Thus... up to is the commitment of Vishnu.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / tshangs pa dang / drag po dang / khyab 'jug gi dam tshig bstan to //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / tshangs pa dang / drag po dang / khyab 'jug gi dam tshig bstan to //
translated: The commitments of the perfect buddhas, bodhisattvas, śrāvakas, Brahmā, Rudra, and Viṣṇu are taught.

original: de ltar tshangs pa la sogs pa zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de ltar tshangs pa la sogs pa zhes pa nas /
translated: Thus, beginning with “Brahmā and so forth,”

original: go sla'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: go sla'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: up to “easy to understand”

original: tshangs pa la sogs pa'i dam tshig ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo por bstan to //
analyzed: tshangs pa la sogs pa'i dam tshig ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo por bstan to //
translated: teaches that the commitments of Brahmā and so forth are the nature of Vairocana and so forth.🔽Thus, beginning with “the chief ones,”

original: de ltar gtso bo rnams kyi zhes pa dang / brtsams pa'i don 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de ltar gtso bo rnams kyi zhes pa dang / brtsams pa'i don 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: up to “for the sake of accomplishing the purpose of the composition,”

original: gnod sbyin mo dang / klu mo dang / lha min mo'i dam tshig bstan to //
analyzed: gnod sbyin mo dang / klu mo dang / lha min mo'i dam tshig bstan to //
translated: teaches the commitments of the yakṣiṇīs, nāginīs, and asurīs.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma mnyes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma mnyes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: For the sake of pleasing the Vajra dakini,🔽up to “they will gather,”

original: nye bar sdud par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma rnams la ji ltar 'dod par nye bar longs spyod par bstan to //
analyzed: nye bar sdud par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma rnams la ji ltar 'dod par nye bar longs spyod par bstan to //
translated: teaches the enjoyment of the dakinis according to one’s desire.

original: khams gsum du 'byung ba zhes pa nas /🔽de skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba la rab tu zhugs pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: khams gsum du 'byung ba zhes pa nas / de skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba la rab tu zhugs pa'i sgo nas /
translated: The phrase arising in the three realms

original: las kyi lam rnam par dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: las kyi lam rnam par dag pa bstan to //
translated: up to thus have I heard indicates the pure path of action from the perspective of engaging in natural luminosity.

original: da ni bsgrub pa rtsom par byed pa'i sngags so zhes pa nas /🔽rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid du bskyed pa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: da ni bsgrub pa rtsom par byed pa'i sngags so zhes pa nas / rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid du bskyed pa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Now, the mantra that initiates the composition of the treatise

original: 'dus pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i phyag 'tshal ba'i bye brag bstan to //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i phyag 'tshal ba'i bye brag bstan to //
translated: up to the conduct that generates the state of Great Vajradhara indicates the specific prostrations of the yogi/nis of Guhyasamaja.

original: bsnyen pa la sogs pa zhes pa nas /🔽'di ni thog ma med pa'i dus can no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: bsnyen pa la sogs pa zhes pa nas / 'di ni thog ma med pa'i dus can no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: The approach and so forth

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams snyoms par zhugs pa spros pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dam tshig bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams snyoms par zhugs pa spros pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dam tshig bstan to //
translated: up to this is beginningless indicates the pledge of the elaboration-characterized meditative concentration of the tathagatas.

original: de ltar de kho na nyid rtogs pas zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de ltar de kho na nyid rtogs pas zhes pa nas /
translated: Thus, by realizing thatness🔽up to the four mudras indicates the four mudras of the yogi/nis of Guhyasamaja.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma nyes par byed pa'i dam tshig go zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma nyes par byed pa'i dam tshig go zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: By the passage, “The Tathāgata’s pledge is to do no evil,”

original: spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: the process of emanating and gathering is taught.

original: de kho na nyid rtogs pa rnams zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de kho na nyid rtogs pa rnams zhes pa nas /
translated: By the passage, “Those who have realized reality,”

original: sems ni mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur //
analyzed: sems ni mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur //
translated: “the mind becomes concentrated.”

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Therefore,

original: bdud rtsi myang ba bstan to //
analyzed: bdud rtsi myang ba bstan to //
translated: the drinking of the elixir is taught.

original: de ltar nang gi bdag nyid la zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de ltar nang gi bdag nyid la zhes pa nas /
translated: By the passage, “Thus, in one’s own inner self,”

original: dag pa rdo rjes de skad ces bka' @199b stsal to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: dag pa rdo rjes de skad ces bka' @199b stsal to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: “the pure vajra spoke thus,”

original: zas dang smra ba dang / sems pa la sogs pa la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bsgom pa bstan to //
analyzed: zas dang smra ba dang / sems pa la sogs pa la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bsgom pa bstan to //
translated: the meditation on Vairocana and so forth in eating, speaking, thinking, and so forth is taught.

original: gang sngar 'das pa dang zhes pa nas /
analyzed: gang sngar 'das pa dang zhes pa nas /
translated: By the passage, “Whatever has been done previously,”

original: cang mi gsung bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: cang mi gsung bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: “remained silent,”

original: las kyi sbyor ba thams cad 'od gsal ba nyid la 'jug pa nyid rnam par dag par bstan to //
analyzed: las kyi sbyor ba thams cad 'od gsal ba nyid la 'jug pa nyid rnam par dag par bstan to //
translated: the purity of all ritual practices is taught to be the very entry into clear light.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa na zhes pa nas zhes sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa na zhes pa nas zhes sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: The passage from “then” up to “should be applied” shows🔽that the bodhisattvas

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la byang chub sems dpas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la byang chub sems dpas /
translated: asked the tathāgatas

original: zhub byas pa na /🔽rdo rje 'chang chen pos bshad pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: zhub byas pa na / rdo rje 'chang chen pos bshad pa'i sgo nas /
translated: and

original: de dag gi the tshom sel ba bstan to //🔽de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de dag gi the tshom sel ba bstan to // de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la zhes pa nas /
translated: the great Vajradhara taught in order to dispel their doubts.🔽Then, etc.

original: 'dra bar nye bar gdags par mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: 'dra bar nye bar gdags par mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: The passage from “then” up to “is designated as such” shows

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i de kho na nyid ni rnyed par dka' ste /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i de kho na nyid ni rnyed par dka' ste /
translated: that the reality of the great Vajradhara is difficult to attain,

original: 'on kyang 'gro ba thams cad ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //🔽de ltar byang chub sems dpa' dang zhes pa nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'gro ba thams cad ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to // de ltar byang chub sems dpa' dang zhes pa nas /
translated: but nevertheless, because all beings are of his nature.🔽Thus, etc.

original: rnam par brtag pa ni ma rnyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rnam par brtag pa ni ma rnyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: The passage from “thus, the bodhisattvas” up to “is not attained” shows

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
translated: that the Blessed One himself taught the samādhi.

original: de ltar rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ting nge 'dzin nges par byas nas zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ting nge 'dzin nges par byas nas zhes pa nas /
translated: Having thus ascertained the meditative stabilization of Great Vajradhara,

original: ngo mtshar du gyur pa'i gnas skabs bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni //
analyzed: ngo mtshar du gyur pa'i gnas skabs bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni //
translated: up to “in order to teach the occasion of the wonder,”

original: zhus pa la lan gdab pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: zhus pa la lan gdab pa'i sgo nas /
translated: the reply to the request

original: rdo rje 'chang gi de kho na nyid gtan la phab pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang gi de kho na nyid gtan la phab pa yin no //
translated: determines the reality of Vajradhara.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes pa nas /
translated: Then, “etc.,” up to

original: ngo mtshar gyi rgyu'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i de kho na nyid la 'khor rnams kyi rjes su yi rang bar bstan to //
analyzed: ngo mtshar gyi rgyu'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i de kho na nyid la 'khor rnams kyi rjes su yi rang bar bstan to //
translated: “the cause of the wonder” teaches the assembly’s rejoicing in the reality taught by the Tathagata.

original: de ltar mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin nges par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin nges par byas nas /
translated: Having thus ascertained the signless meditative stabilization,

original: zhag bdun gyis rtse gcig pa thob pas zhes pa ni zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: zhag bdun gyis rtse gcig pa thob pas zhes pa ni zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: “having attained one-pointedness in seven days,” up to

original: thugs rdo rje bsgoms pas dbang po gnyis kyi mtshon pas snyoms par zhugs pa bstan to //
analyzed: thugs rdo rje bsgoms pas dbang po gnyis kyi mtshon pas snyoms par zhugs pa bstan to //
translated: “etc.,” teaches the meditative cultivation of the mind vajra, and the union symbolized by the two organs.

original: ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa ni zhes pa nas /
analyzed: ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa ni zhes pa nas /
translated: The union with the wisdom consort is as follows.🔽

original: de sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / lhan cig snyoms par zhugs pa bstan to //🔽de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i zhes pa nas /🔽sdud par byed pa'i tshig go zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /🔽phyi rol gyi phyag rgya spangs nas /🔽sku @200a * //
analyzed: de sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / lhan cig snyoms par zhugs pa bstan to // de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i zhes pa nas / sdud par byed pa'i tshig go zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni / phyi rol gyi phyag rgya spangs nas / sku @200a * //
translated: The passage from “one who enters into union with the wisdom seal” up to “he will attain buddhahood” teaches the union with the pledge seal.

original: rdo rje la sogs pa'i dam tshig gsum bstan to //🔽spyod pa gsum la gnas pa yi //
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pa'i dam tshig gsum bstan to // spyod pa gsum la gnas pa yi //
translated: The passage from “then” up to “the words of the chapter on the pledge” teaches the abandonment of the external seal and the three pledges of body vajra and so on.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: The passage from “one who abides in the three conducts” up to “the words of the chapter on the conduct” teaches the three conducts.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: The passage from “then” up to “the words of the chapter on the result” teaches the result.🔽The passage from “then” up to “the words of the chapter on the summary” teaches the summary.🔽The passage from “then” up to “the words of the chapter on the praise” teaches the praise.🔽The passage from “then” up to “the words of the chapter on the offering” teaches the offering.

original: phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor la mngon par zhen pa bsal nas /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor la mngon par zhen pa bsal nas /
translated: The passage from “then” up to “the words of the chapter on the mandala” teaches the mandala.🔽The passage from “then” up to “the words of the chapter on the self-empowerment” teaches the self-empowerment.🔽The passage from “then” up to “the words of the chapter on the consecration” teaches the consecration.

original: phung po la sogs pa nyid de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa nyid de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The passage from “then” up to “the words of the chapter on the burnt offerings” teaches the burnt offerings.🔽The passage from “then” up to “the words of the chapter on the repetition” teaches the repetition.🔽The passage from “then” up to “the words of the chapter on the maṇḍala” teaches the maṇḍala.

original: de ltar rnam par snang mdzad la sog pa zhes pa nas don dam pa'i bden pa la zhugs par gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar du'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par snang mdzad la sog pa zhes pa nas don dam pa'i bden pa la zhugs par gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar du'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Thus, from “Vairocana” up to “entered into ultimate reality” shows

original: bcom ldan 'das 'od gsal ba nyid la bzhugs par bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'od gsal ba nyid la bzhugs par bstan to //
translated: that the Bhagavān abides in luminosity.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po zhes pa nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po zhes pa nas /
translated: The Bhagavān Mahāvairocana, having entered into the ultimate reality,🔽remained silent.

original: de'i phyir byams pa cang mi gsung bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpas de bzhin gshegs pa la rdo rje slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid zhus pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir byams pa cang mi gsung bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpas de bzhin gshegs pa la rdo rje slob dpon gyi mtshan nyid zhus pa ni /
translated: The bodhisattva Maitreya, having bowed to the Tathāgata, asked about the characteristics of a vajra master.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bor rdo rje slob dpon bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bor rdo rje slob dpon bstan to //
translated: The Tathāgata, being the essence of all tathāgatas, taught the vajra master.

original: de ltar byams pa cang mi smra bar gyur bas zhes pa nas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de ltar byams pa cang mi smra bar gyur bas zhes pa nas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Thus, Maitreya remained silent.

original: zhus pa'i lan dang de bzhin du rdo rje slob dpon gyi phan yon sgyu 'phrul dra ba zhes bya ba'i rgyud chen po dang / de bzhin du rin chen rgyal po zhes bya ba'i mdo chen po dang / de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma stong phrag brgya ba tshad mar byas nas /
analyzed: zhus pa'i lan dang de bzhin du rdo rje slob dpon gyi phan yon sgyu 'phrul dra ba zhes bya ba'i rgyud chen po dang / de bzhin du rin chen rgyal po zhes bya ba'i mdo chen po dang / de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma stong phrag brgya ba tshad mar byas nas /
translated: and likewise, having taken as authoritative the Blessed Lady in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas,

original: rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsungs so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsungs so //
translated: it was taught by Great Vajradhara.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: Then,

original: bsam gtan gyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: up to the “mandala of meditative concentration,”

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i sku lha mo bzhis bskor ba'i nang du rdo rje 'chang chen po bzhugs pa bskyed nas /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i sku lha mo bzhis bskor ba'i nang du rdo rje 'chang chen po bzhugs pa bskyed nas /
translated: having generated the Great Vajradhara residing within the retinue of the four goddesses of body, Akshobya, and so on,

original: slob ma dbang bskur ba nang gi rim pa phan yon dang bcas pa gsungs so //
analyzed: slob ma dbang bskur ba nang gi rim pa phan yon dang bcas pa gsungs so //
translated: the initiation of the disciple and the inner stages with benefits are taught.

original: gzhan yang gdug pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang gdug pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, “the wicked”🔽up to “the special excellence of the union”

original: sbyor ba'i phul du byung ba'i khyad par bstan pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i phul du byung ba'i khyad par bstan pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: are taught.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la phyag drug pa bsgoms pas ma rungs pa tshar bcad par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la phyag drug pa bsgoms pas ma rungs pa tshar bcad par bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that by meditating on the Vajraḍāka with six faces, the wicked are destroyed.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la zhes pa nas /
translated: Then, etc.

original: 'da' bar mi bya ba'i dam tshig go zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni nang gi sbyin sreg dang thun mong gi mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'da' bar mi bya ba'i dam tshig go zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni nang gi sbyin sreg dang thun mong gi mchod pa bstan to //
translated: Up to “the pledge not to be transgressed” teaches the inner fire offering and the common worship.

original: de ltar thun mong gi mchod pa bstan nas zhes pa nas /🔽thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de ltar thun mong gi mchod pa bstan nas zhes pa nas / thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Having thus taught the common worship,

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi ched du thun mong gi mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi ched du thun mong gi mchod pa bstan to //
translated: up to “will be attained” teaches the common worship for one’s own and others’ sake.

original: de ltar @200b bdag dang gzhan pa mchod pa bstan nas zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de ltar @200b bdag dang gzhan pa mchod pa bstan nas zhes pa nas /
translated: Having thus taught the worship for one’s own and others’ sake,

original: phul du byung ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sems can gyi khams mtha' dag la mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: phul du byung ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sems can gyi khams mtha' dag la mchod pa bstan to //
translated: up to “excellent” teaches the worship of the entire realm of sentient beings.

original: de ltar mchod pa'i rnam par bstan nas zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de ltar mchod pa'i rnam par bstan nas zhes pa nas /
translated: Having thus taught the forms of worship,

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: up to “because it has an object” teaches the worship of the guru.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i 'jug pa bstan to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i 'jug pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the engagement of the yogi.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor pa sems can rnams kyi yul la rab tu 'jug pa bstan nas zhes pa nas zhes bya ba'i phan yon no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor pa sems can rnams kyi yul la rab tu 'jug pa bstan nas zhes pa nas zhes bya ba'i phan yon no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Thus, having taught the engagement of the yogi in the objects of sentient beings, up to “thus” teaches the benefit.

original: rnal 'byor pa skyo bar gyur na bdud rtsis bda' zhing tshim par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa skyo bar gyur na bdud rtsis bda' zhing tshim par bya ba bstan to //
translated: If the yogi becomes weary, he should be encouraged and satisfied with nectar.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa rtogs par gyur ba zhes pa nas /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa rtogs par gyur ba zhes pa nas /
translated: Having realized the stage of completion, up to

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa la ni dgag pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa la ni dgag pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: “there is no prohibition for one who is free of attachment,”

original: 'dus pa'i rnal 'byor pas phyi rol gyi mchod rten la phyag la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa spang bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rnal 'byor pas phyi rol gyi mchod rten la phyag la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa spang bar bstan to //
translated: this teaches the assembled yogi to abandon attachment to external worship of the caitya and so forth.

original: le'u bco lnga pa las gsungs pa zhes pa nas /
analyzed: le'u bco lnga pa las gsungs pa zhes pa nas /
translated: As it is said in the fifteenth chapter, up to

original: de kho na nyid las gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /🔽dug sel ba bstan to //
analyzed: de kho na nyid las gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni / dug sel ba bstan to //
translated: “one should abide in reality,”🔽this teaches the removal of poison.

original: de ltar dug bsal ba zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de ltar dug bsal ba zhes pa nas /
translated: Thus, having removed the poison, up to

original: bdud rtsi thab sbyor srung ba'i 'khor lo bstan to //

translated: The passage from “Vajrapāṇi said to the Bhagavān” up to “Samantabhadra said” teaches the protection wheel of amṛtaḍāka in order to prevent the illness of the person who has been cured from arising again.🔽Then, from “Then the compiler” up to “remained silent” teaches the Bhagavān’s nature of tantra through the request of the retinue.

original: de nas sdud par byed pa zhes pa nas cang mi gsung bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'khor gyis zhus pas bcom ldan 'das kyi rgyud kyi bdag nyid bstan to zhes bya ba ni de ltar the tshom dang bral ba'i zhes pa nas /🔽phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /🔽sngon du gyur ba'i sgo nas sngon byung ba rnyed par dka' la de ltar ni rgyud 'di rnyed par sla bar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //🔽gsang ba 'dus pa 'di la zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas sdud par byed pa zhes pa nas cang mi gsung bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'khor gyis zhus pas bcom ldan 'das kyi rgyud kyi bdag nyid bstan to zhes bya ba ni de ltar the tshom dang bral ba'i zhes pa nas / phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni / sngon du gyur ba'i sgo nas sngon byung ba rnyed par dka' la de ltar ni rgyud 'di rnyed par sla bar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so // gsang ba 'dus pa 'di la zhes pa nas /
translated: From “Thus, free from doubt” up to “will be endowed with perfection” teaches the difficulty of obtaining the past.🔽In that way, the Bhagavān taught that this tantra is easy to obtain.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: From “In this Guhyasamāja” up to “is an explanation of the implied meaning” teaches the difficulty of obtaining the future.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams skye ba la the tshom du gyur ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams skye ba la the tshom du gyur ba la /
translated: For the Bodhisattvas, there is doubt about birth.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis the tshom spang ba bstan to //

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa nas /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the Tathagata,

original: bcom ldan 'das la rab tu zhugs par gyur to //

original: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi bka' drin gyis rgyud kyi don dang tshul zhes pa nas pha rol gyi mtha' nges par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /

translated: The meaning of the tantra should be ascertained by the kindness of the master's words.🔽

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa klu sgrub lung bstan pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa klu sgrub lung bstan pa /
translated: The passage from By the kindness of the master's face up to one should ascertain the limits of the other indicates the prediction of noble Nagarjuna by the Bhagavat in the noble Lankavatara Sutra.

original: rang gi slob dpon la dad pas phan yon bstan pa yin no //🔽da ni rgyud nye bar sdud bar byed de zhes pa nas /
analyzed: rang gi slob dpon la dad pas phan yon bstan pa yin no // da ni rgyud nye bar sdud bar byed de zhes pa nas /
translated: It also shows the benefits of faith in one's master.🔽Now, in order to summarize the tantra, it says the one who summarizes the tantra up to chapter.

original: le'u zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sdud pa pos rgyud kyi mjug bsdu ba dang / don dang ldan pa'i ming le'u bstan to //🔽bde bar gshegs pa gsung shin tu phra ba'i rnal 'byor rgyud ces pa nas /

translated: This shows the summary of the tantra by the compiler and the chapter with a meaningful name.

original: bde ba dam pa'i gnas mchog @201b zla ba'i bro dang 'gro ba rnams ni ldan par shog / ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni /

translated: The passage from the yoga tantra of the Sugata's extremely subtle speech up to may all beings be endowed with the supreme abode of sublime bliss

original: rang gi 'grel pa'i phan yon dang // bsod nams bsngo ba bstan to //
analyzed: rang gi 'grel pa'i phan yon dang // bsod nams bsngo ba bstan to //

original: mtha' drugs  gcod byas pa yis //
analyzed: mtha' drugs  gcod byas pa yis //
translated: By means of this analysis of the six limits,

original: dge ba bdag gis gang thob pa //
analyzed: dge ba bdag gis gang thob pa //
translated: Whatever virtue I have obtained,

original: des ni 'jig rten ma lus pa //
analyzed: des ni 'jig rten ma lus pa //

original: 'jam pa'i gzhon nu 'dra bar shog /'jig rten dbang phyug lhan cig bde ba'i ting 'dzin gnas //
analyzed: 'jam pa'i gzhon nu 'dra bar shog /'jig rten dbang phyug lhan cig bde ba'i ting 'dzin gnas //

original: sa steng gus pas brten pa 'khor ba'i gdung ba sel //
analyzed: sa steng gus pas brten pa 'khor ba'i gdung ba sel //
translated: Resorting with devotion to the earth, dispelling the torment of saṃsāra,

original: gang gi drin gyi dbang gis bdag gi ngag 'byor pa //
analyzed: gang gi drin gyi dbang gis bdag gi ngag 'byor pa //
translated: By the power of whose kindness my speech is refined,🔽May that queen of speech, Vāgīśvarī, be victorious.

original: ngag gi dbang phyug gos dkar mo de rgyal gyur cig / sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i le'u bcu bdun pa'i sa bcad pa'o /

original: // / sgron ma gsal ba'i mdor bshad pa'i sa bcad snying gi me long zhes bya ba /
analyzed: // / sgron ma gsal ba'i mdor bshad pa'i sa bcad snying gi me long zhes bya ba /
translated: The Outline of the Commentary Illuminating the Lamp, Called The Mirror of the Heart

original: dpal lakshm'i ka ri'i zhal snga nas kyi slob ma /
analyzed: dpal lakshm'i ka ri'i zhal snga nas kyi slob ma /
translated: By the disciple of the glorious Lakṣmīṅkara

original: pandi ta mkhas pa chen po ku m'a ras mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: pandi ta mkhas pa chen po ku m'a ras mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The great learned paṇḍita Kumāra.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po panda ti gzhon nu bum pa can dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba dge slong sh'akya blo gros kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po panda ti gzhon nu bum pa can dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba dge slong sh'akya blo gros kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
translated: The Indian abbot Pandita Kumārabhuta and the Tibetan translator, the monk Śākya Lodrö, translated, revised, and finalized this text.
